desc: The Pros: clean and comfortable rooms. Multiple eateries nearby, close to MRT and airport. The cons: no room service / cafe. Inefficient front desk - took ages to check in / check out. Double charged me before check-in, then cancelled the charge with no apologies.

title: Great Stay
desc: Front desk staff was very friendly,kudos to athirah n manzoor.thanks for the early check in.breakfast at lemon n herbs was great.will come back again in the near future.keep up the good work guys cheers

title: Unsatisfactory Service
desc: I am utterly shocked and dissatisfied with your management today when I was told that your hotel is fully booked. This is ridiculous because I had booked the room online about two months ago. You have ample of time to inform me if that was the case. But you didn't. In fact, you chose to send me to another hotel branch at Rochester as I was told that there were no rooms available at the nearby hotel at Changi. I was promised to be given a room on the next day but there is no proper following up by Changi branch. I have to get a confirmation from Rochester front desk staff which cause us wasting lots of time to settle the issue. It's already added up unnecessary stress to me and my Daughter. Now I am worried because my daughter is sitting for the AEIS at the expo in Changi next

title: Recommended Hotel
desc: Location is excellent - just a 5 mins walk to the Expo MRT station. Rooms are clean, nice and comfortable. 2 bedroom unit comes with a small kitchenette, microwave, fridge and even a washing machine. Good for a short getaway trip. There are choices of eateries within walking distance at the nearby malls. Can take a train down to Changi Airport for eating and shopping too. Kudos to Mansor and Jessica for a smooth check in and all assistance rendered! . Julie

title: Clean and Nice
desc: I was staying at the Hotel for business purposes since my activity is near the location of the Hotel. I was impressed with the size of the room and it is clean and comfortable. Park Avenue was providing a smartphone that can be used by the guest during their stay at the hotel and Singapore. One thing to add it's totally free. So you can definitely forget buying Singapore simcard during your stay. Something i don't like during my stay is the hotel doesn't have any restaurant so you need to walk across the hotel for breakfast at local restaurant with the voucher from the hotel. If you plan to have dinner at your room then you should buy your dinner from outside of the hotel because it doesnt have room service. But dont worry, because the hotel is strategically located around the

title: A Recommended Hotel
desc: Hotel room is nice and comfortable , would recommend to families or individuals who would love a short getaway trip . Hotel is near the MRT Station and Changi City point(5mins walk) . There is Fairprice located just in front of the hotel which makes buying groceries a bliss . Would definitely recommend people to give this hotel a go! We would like to thank , Duty Manager , Khairun Helmi and fellow staff for their great assistance during our stay there . -Khairi

title: Excellent Service and support from Park Avenue Convention Team
desc: To Mr Taufik & Mr Sufianhadi, I wanted to drop you both a note and thank you so much for your excellent and professional service render during the wedding event setup. Hope to be working with you guys again for any upcoming event. Thumbs Up!

title: Awesome Stay!
desc: Had a wonderful experience here in Park Avenue Hotel Changi. The room was nice and clean. Front desk were very friendly upon check in. My family and I enjoyed our one night stay there. Special mention to Mr Khairun Helmi for accommodating to our needs. We would definitely recommend others to stay in the hotel.

title: Super amazing hotel
desc: Location of the hotel just 7 minute walk from train station,the room is very small and simple,good for solo travel.they provide tea and coffee in room,hotel have small swimming pool. Special thanks to manager Justin & Siti for the prompt respond and service rendered. Will choose back this hotel for my next trip.

title: Nice hotel
desc: It is a nice hotel in the upcoming business district of SG, The rooms were ok and the staff were very courteous especially Teddy. It is near Expo station (3 minute walk) which connects you to a world class public transport system and you can be anywhere in the city in an hour. and their phone was also very helpful given that in Singapore internet is expensive. Pool is small but nice since it is a rooftop pool. Breakfast is nice especially YumCha restaurant which has an early morning buffet. If you are here in SG for work and in the Changi business district Parkavenue is the best hotel to be in. With the mall and metro in a walking distance.

title: Business or Budget Hotel ?
desc: I stayed at this hotel in July for I think 3 days on business since it is near to my office. Overall the hotel room and amenities are quite ok and standard. Downsides are 1) No hotel lobby. It is only a reception for check in and that's it. Looks more like a budget hotel to me than a business hotel. 2) During the time of my stay, there was also a large group of tourists from China and during breakfast , they were quite rowdy bunch. 3) I'm surprised this hotel does not have an in house restaurant and engage a 3rd party cafe opposite the hotel for the guests breakfast. 4) The cafe they use for the breakfast is honestly quite bad as the spread and variety does not really represent a hotel breakfast spread. The spread was mainly chinese based dim sum spread. 5) After breakfast

title: Business Hotel - Helpful and Attentive Staff but Location is Not great
desc: This is just a business hotel without too many bells and whistles in an office/industrial area. There is one mall with some dining options but the hotel is along way from downtown, 30 minutes by train or 20 minutes by taxi. The rooms were clean and adequate for a business traveller. The staff were very good in terms of their service and efficiency, in some cases they would anticipate my needs which was really nice. If I was in town on business again would have no problem staying here again but definitely not for a vacation.

title: Great service from convention centre staff
desc: I would like to share my happiness regarding about the wonderful, helpful, patience service staff that willing to entertain us every week cisco system event . Perfect service standard for seminar that run by taufik and his av tech sufian . With their perfect service really make my day goes wow . Keep it up guys .

title: Certainly Not a Business Hotel, but rather a budget hotel for Chinese tourists
desc: This is perhaps the worst hotel I have stayed in since staying in Xi'an in 1985. To start with the positive ... the rooms are indeed modern, clean, large, and entirely acceptable. And that's where it stops. 我会说一点二汉语 — I speak a little Chinese. If you don't, don't even think about staying here because the staff will not be especially helpful. The facilities are inadequate. There is no restaurant. Full stop. To repeat, the hotel has no restaurant. If it is not raining too hard, you can walk across the court yard to a restaurant that will serve you a barely adequate breakfast. There were two set buffets, which varied at random, day by day. One was edible. The other was not. Timing is critical. You can't show up for breakfast at 7.30, when the restaurant is

title: Awesome service and support from Park Avenue Convention Team
desc: Had a 2-day team building/conference at Park Avenue Convention Centre and was amazed by Shak and his team's support towards the event. Muhd Taufik and his colleague Sufian Hadi went above and beyond their duties to ensure the event went on smoothly. We are very appreciative of their support and will definitely return to the venue in our future events.

title: A lovely surprise
desc: What a lovely surprise to be greeted so warmly by reception staff at Park Avenue Changi Hotel. They must have noticed I looked very tired after the long flight and found me a room straight away, several hours before the standard check-in time. The spacious well appointed room did not disappoint. The bed was so comfortable I slept for almost 10 hours. The bathroom was large with a shower over the bath - lovely toiletries and they'd even included a toothbrush and paste. I was only in Singapore overnight so no need to make much use of the complimentary mobile phone - what a great idea, free data and local calls for the duration of your stay. The hotel is situated only a 5-minute taxi trip from Changi Airport so really handy for a stopover. It's also a 5-minute walk from the MRT

title: Budget hotel in midst of light industry / office park
desc: Budget hotel in midst of light industry / office park, largely catering to younger, junior call center and tech workers staying on business travel and extended stay. Humble and insufficiently clean rooms with low end décor, and a down market bath – suitable, if forced, for brief business stay and sleeping. Just really, really bad. No lobby, no business center, and no restaurant. Poor front desk service – clearly accustomed to budget travelers. Room service was available, no menu in room (had to go to front desk for menu); food not at all good (ordered twice, and did not manage more than a bite of each), showed up wrapped in clear plastic wrap, poorly prepared, poorly delivered – again, just awful. No shop for sundries or snacks as at most budget hotels. Next to small

title: Great rooms and staff
desc: The hotel staff was very nice. My family and ran into Muhammad Ariff at one of the malls, he came over to us and wanted to make sure we were finding everything okay. He gave us great suggestions on other places to see during our visit

title: pleasant stay at Park Avenue
desc: The location is great; very close (3 mins walk) to a huge mall called the Expo and also the MTR (metro) line. The hotel is very clean and well maintained, the reception staff were incredibly polite, professional and helpful. The room was great; me and my son got an upgrade to a suite! Breakfast was also very nice, with lots to choose from, both Eastern and Western options. The only downside to the stay was breakfast or rather the staff. I found the female waitresses, hostess there patronising when speaking to me, and were clearly not happy when we came to breakfast close to closing time. We felt very unwelcome and the staff were constantly cleaning round us as though they were trying to get us to leave quickly. I would suggest that the breakfast staff be more mindful of guests

title: Nearest to Singapore Expo and Convention Centre
desc: Park Avenue Hotel is very near to the Singapore Expo Centre. This hotel is located at the Changi Business Park, obviously, this is a Business hotel. Its proximity to the airport is really a plus factor especially if you are going to visit the Singapore Expo centre for business. It is also beside a shopping mall where restaurants , fast food stores and a factory outlet of sneakers can be found. There is also an MRT station right at the Singapore Expo. I like the contemporary interior & exteriors of the hotel. Our room has an ironing board which I really appreciated. I even used it to iron my husbands clothes. The bathroom of our room has a big clear glass so if you are in the room you can see who is inside the bathroom although it has also blinds to obscure you. The hotel

title: A home to me
desc: During my stay at this hotel, was an accident. I search out the area and find out this hotel which fulfill my request. It near MRT which is EXPO station, 1 more station to changi airport. It pretty much a nice and convenient place for one night before your flight. The room was great, this is a 3rd time my visit to this hotel. I was stay on one bedroom suite, which kind a home to me. It provide a kitchen, washing machine for traveller. Within kitchen, it have almost all the tool to make a fine dinner or breakfast. Beside is FairPrice Xtra, a market to purchase ingredient to cook. Overall this is a moment that i experience was something i will like to remember, and for truth, i will always coming for this hotel if i was in singapore for my vacation.

title: Breakfast very poor, lobby does not exist, no bar service
desc: Nice and clean hotel. Staff efficient and polite. Some strange thinks to be highlighted. The lobby is very small and it is impossible to fix meetings with customers or people from outside because the lobby piratically does not exist. There is the front desk and the elevators. They have no toilette in the lobby and if you need it you have to go in a public bath outside the building or in your room. If you buy the breakfast you have to spend it in a breakfast bar just in front of the hotel, that is not absolutely at the standard of the hotel itself. The fridge in the room is present, but empty. For these reasons the hotel is just a good sleeping place, do not expect more services that usually are considered as standard in a medim standard hotel.

title: Singapore Expo - Nearby Hotels
desc: Very nice hotel, 10 minute walk to Singapore Expo center in Changi business city. Multiple eateries within a 1-2 minute walk of hotel lobby. Department/grocery store is 3 minutes away; and, a shopping mall & fast food, food court also a few minutes away.

title: Excellent faclities and proximity to all amenities and MRT.
desc: Excellent faclities and proximity to all amenities and MRT: The hotel and staff were extremely professional and my stay was very comfortable. I was there for 3 weeks and it was a very relaxed yet productive stay.

title: Wonderful stay and service
desc: Me and my family was booked for 2 rooms and we came early and the friendly staff gave us mineral water and gave us the room early. What a first impression. Staff at the front office was very attentive and help us a lot. Room was okay and clean. Pool was small and the gym is small too...but its okay for a staycation. What we were amazed was he friendly service from front office ans d he manager on duty. THANK YOU FOR A WONDERFUL SERVICE AN WE FEEL LIKE HOME! WE will definitely come back and recommend this hotel.

title: Lovely warm welcome
desc: We stayed here overnight waiting for our flight to Kota Kinabalu, The staff were excellent and very professional, Room was great ,couldn't have asked for anything else Close to airport. Shops, and you can choose restaurants close by about a minutes walk

title: Proximity to the Expo is the only thing going for it
desc: We chose this hotel for its proximity to the Expo, but it is the only reason we would choose to stay there. The staff weren't particularly friendly and the room was showing some wear and tear. There was nothing that would make this hotel stand out from the rest, it doesn't have a restaurant and therefore no room service, so you have to leave the hotel for every meal. Fortunately there are options around, a mall and supermarket close by. Upon checking in there were a few issues with the room. The bathroom light couldn't turn off and the to had a problem which couldn't be solved immediately. The door to the cabinet containing the bar fridge was coming off its hinges and needed to be fixed. I would use the hotel again, if I was attending a conference and not planning to be

title: Pretty Standard
desc: Expo is a still-developing area at the first MRT stop from the airport, and the hotel is a short walk from there (walk diagonally opposite the road to the left out of the station and the hotel is in the back of that complex of buildings). So the big plus is it is a good location for someone like us who arrived on a late flight and wanted somewhere close. The hotel is accommodation only so you will need to rely on the few nearby restaurants and food outlets - not a great selection, although there is a supermarket opposite the hotel and the nearby outlet centre has a few low-cost eating options (and a larger supermarket). The room was your standard hotel room, perfectly fine although we noticed a bit of dirt between the tiles in the bathroom which was a little off-putting

title: Stay for a while
desc: Had a two day stop over, but would use it for an extended holiday. It is close to the airport and the Expo MRT stop. The MRT stop is nearly across the road from the hotel. The taxi ride from the airport is $6, unless you get one who wants to go around the block a couple of times and then you get charged $15. There is a Mall next door to the hotel with plenty of eating options. The rooms are big, no noise and well looked after. The staff are nice. Would use it again.

title: Bring your own cleaning supplies and food
desc: Location would be the only reason anyone would or should every stay at this hotel but if you are inclined to stay here you sould opt out of any charges for breakfast buffet and bring you own food and drink. Luckily there is a supermarket right next to the hotel. You might want to bring some sanitary wipes as I had blood on my toilet seat when I arrived.

title: Miss
desc: The room is quite comfortable and the environment is good.Very close to the MRT EXPO，just1-2mins walk.And the amenities are convenient.The supermarket ，the outlet，the restaurants，the bar！Excellent experience！Highly Recommended！

title: One bedroom suite
desc: I booked one bedroom suite on 29 April 2017.Room was clean and big enough to accommodate my family.Staff were friendly and customer orientated.Duty Manager on duty Mr Manzoor, processed our check in fast and efficiently. It took less than 10mins and he personally showed us to our room as we were 1st time there.We were amazed by the way they handle customers and definitely I will give 5 stars to Mr Manzoor and the team for making our stay a memorable one. Highly recommended

title: Great for stay-in
desc: Great place if your focus is just in the stay. Awesome value for money. Had a 1 bedroom suite with tub. Had everything you need. Was impressed they had a coffee brewer, bread toaster, and washer/dryer (2-in-1). They paid attention to the small details of having potato peelers and can-opener as well. Only facilities was a gym and a very tiny pool which wasn't attractive. Supermarket, outlet shopping mall, and plenty of eating options just next door. Only compliant is for hotel staff to make sure everything is in working order before admitting guests. The TV was flickering in the living room and later in the evening, the tub couldn't drain. The staff did fix them promptly, but still.. could have done without the interruptions.

title: Super awesome
desc: excellent service from TEDDY the guy check me in at lobby. Room was super awesome.. just need to check again for TV at Hall King Suite room can't connect.. But overall is Great Services.. will come back here again.. checkout next Tuesday..

title: Decent Hotel!!!
desc: I stayed in their Two Bedroom suite for around 3 Months on a Business trip. I would say, this is just a Hotel and none of the other facilities must be expected. Its a good hotel with all basic features which all hotels provide but this Hotel stands out on below 1. Location: Right in the Business Hub Changi area. Okayish crowded during the day but very calm and silent at night with lots of greenery to walk around (very unlike other hotels which would be in the heart of Singapore) 2. Connected with all parts of Singapore via MRT 3. More affordable then other hotels in Singapore 4. Far from popular Singapore night life 5. Staff is OK. 6. Housekeeping is efficient and good All in all, a decent place to stay and that is it. To enjoy Singapore, you have to travel a bit via Cab or

title: If you don't demand much
desc: Room is ok, basic. I wouldn't say it's big, just the right size. Staff are all very friendly n helful Location is nowhere in the middle, taxi drivers having hard time to locate it. The restaurant for breakfast is just far from okay.

title: close to airport, nice hotel
desc: The room was quite small but had all the things you need. Not too impressed with a shower curtain, but the SKY sport channel was a bonus after 14 days without in another country.As we arrived close to midnight we wanted to extend our stay till 6 pm the next day as our flight was in the evening. We had to pay another 100 dollars extra which made our short stay very expensive. That's the only reason why we would not stay here again.

title: Basically….
desc: Basically, there is nothing more basic then what the basic rooms provided by this basic hotel can provide under its basic price. There is only one other hotel in the area, so can’t compare basicness to basically anything else. Rooms were pleasant, it was the only upside. However, it was small, its tiny Singapore after all. What I did not really like was there was no basic restaurant and no basic breakfast in my basic package. Forking out extra for a package with breakfast I was told ain’t really worth it. You had to head out opposite for basic breakfast. Given a choice I will not like to stay here for business again. It’s just not cut out to be really a business hotel somehow. Too basic. Gave me a feeling of high end backpackers motel.

title: Clean, comfy and neat hotel
desc: The hotel is looking new, comfy and all amenities provided with environmental friendly drinking tap. It's clean and with breakfast provided at the Yumcha restaurant. As this hotel is new, not all cab drivers is aware of its location, thus best for you to give nearest landmark like the Changi Point mall.

title: Great value option very close to Changi Airport
desc: We stayed at the Park Avenue for one night while staying over in Singapore. Location is great - one stop on the MRT from the airport or less than 10mins by car. There is a shopping centre right next door with good shopping and a wide variety of eating options. The room was good - nice size and design, and hotel overall is good quality. The staff were lovely and very helpful, offering us a couple of bottles of water on check-in when they noticed we were a little hot! Would definitely stay again for a short stay in Singapore.

title: Rooms are great. But staff needs improvement.
desc: Book the hotel thru email. All in all was a smooth process. Check in was ok. Just that the hotel does not have a inhouse restaurant. Its more like a service apartment. On the day of checking out,receptionist called my room around 12noon asking when will I be checking out. I informed her that from the email it stated 4pm as I had booked an executive 1 bedroom room. But she insisted that its subject to availability. So i said but the email wrote 4pm. Again she repeated subject to availbility. By then i was furious and kept quiet as i was not that well and was still in bed. She then demanded that i leave the room by 2pm. She said " I give you until 2pm!" I hang up. Left the room at 2.30pm. Saw her name. Fiona. Rude. Room service was similar. Opened my door and then laugh as she

title: overnight stop
desc: a hotel cloe to the airport as a on night stop was perfect.lovely big hotel with a nice big room.comfy bed & lovely bathroom,fridge,ironmobil phone for free use to certain countries.very close to a large supermarket & shopping centre.

title: Great Location
desc: I stayed here for a week in March for a conference. Great location and within walking distance to many restaurants, shopping mall, McDonalds supermarket etc.. The metro is a short walk away. Room service was excellent and always fresh towels, and new toiletries daily. My only negative thing was on check out I was charged approximately $500.00 Singapore dollars. They said they don't charge your total room rate until check out. I am sure it was probably in written form and I must have not read it, but since I wasnt aware, it was quite a shock to check out thinking you already paid for it all ready and to find out you owe that much money. I prefer hotels that you get billed one time. Also like many people have already said there is no restaurant or breakfast. I personally always

title: Good stay for business trip
desc: Managed to check in earlier, and got our late check out too at 2pm. Room is quite spacious, bed is comfortable. Toilet is equipped with basic toiletries, generally good stay for business trip. Walking distance to Singapore Expo.

title: Nice
desc: A nice room with kitchenette, equipped with all the potteries, utensils you need. However, there is no dishwashing liquid but you can approach the housekeeping staff for it. There is also a washing machine and the room is big and comfortable. The quilt is a little bit short for me, as I wasn't seem to be able cover high up. The pool was fine- a small and short lap pool. The gym was pretty good but the floor that the gym and pool are located is a office area (with many small offices and a public pantry for them), which is pretty odd for me. The location is good. With Expo having events and sales, which you may visit and a supermart downstairs that you may purchase ingredients from if you're keen to cook. But do note that the supermart (NTUC fairprice) is not 24 hours. There

title: Late Check Out 4pm was just marketing trick
desc: Was promised late check out 4pm, but when we called on the day we suppose to checked out, was told the hotel's full. From my observation the hotel was very quiet, so how come it's full. This observed on 2pm the time we check out. Saw lots of comments mentioned the same thing, so i suppose late check out was just marketing tricks. Hotel looks old, and the pool is pathetic, too small. Room wise quite ok, but is not worth 280$ a nite. Lucky we got coupon for 160$ only. Not for family as there's nothing to do there, just a small mall. For 280$ I would rather stay at amara sentosa, same size of room but better view and location.

title: Quiet stay and convenient but not the best choice.
desc: Convenient location near Expo MRT. Clean and big room. However the bathroom is on the dirty side. Its old and even the toilet bowl is shaky when you sit on it. Bathtub is small and with stains/hairs. Overall, I will say the room is okay if you do not mind the old and dirty bathroom. For the price paid for the room, I can get a better room at Capri by Fraser (walking distance to MRT too) which is so much cleaner and better service.

title: Excellent service
desc: We came early and got the room early, what a super Service. Reception was very friendly and welcoming. Check in was fast and we went up to our room with the bellboy help. RMB is small but clean and pool is small. Overall excellent service from front office. Thank you and I will definitely recommend your hotel.

title: Nice location, comfortable stay
desc: Stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is just a few minutes walk from Expo MRT station, which is the next train station after airport. Perfect for business travelers especially those working in the expo area or short stay between flights, not perfect for leisure travelers which multiple days in Singapore, as the MRT ride is around 30 minutes from the city centre. Check in was efficient and staff are very friendly. Room is not big but adequate, clean and tidy.

title: Great Hotel Located Close to Changi Airport
desc: A short 5 minute cab drive from the Changi Airport. The location was perfect for an overnight stay before catching and early morning flight. The room was clean and comfortable. Check in was easy, FYI you will need to leave a security deposit on credit card even if you have paid in full. Easy walking distance to shopping mall, and plenty of restaurants surround the hotel as well. Internet connectivity was good. Easy access to public transit if you want to go into the city.

title: Poor Staff training
desc: The Hotel is quite dirty for a 4-5 star hotel and looks old even though is not. The staff is not friendly and when you travel with kids the first thing you want is someone that takes the stress off you when you get to your hotel. I definitely will never be back there.

title: Clean, convenient, serviceable option for transit stop
desc: We arrived at Park Avenue Hotel Changi quite late after a long flight from Beijing, with a moderately early departure the next morning. Check in staff were efficient and polite, allowing our children and grandparents to go up to the room while I completed checkin formalities. The rooms were clean and decent, although the open-plan bathroom design might not be to everyone's liking. Checkout was also smooth, with special help from Mr Ali in raising two taxis and guiding us to the right cars. Would stay again for transit stop. Location is in a business park, but in Singapore even that means greenery and spotless surrounds.

title: Great hotel for working trips
desc: I had to travel to Changi Business park for work last week and I stayed at the Park Avenue hotel, the rooms were well laid out and close to the shopping centre and restaurants. Over all a good hotel to use when traveling for business.

title: Thank you Mr Mansoor
desc: Having staycationed at Park Rochester for quite a number of times, I decided to try Park Avenue Changi. Applying through their same official website, we took it for granted that it'd be automatically upgraded to the 1 room suite. Although it is written that it'd be subjected to availability, it has not happen once during my staycation at Park Rochester. The staycation this time was to celebrate 3 family members' birthday. However, I was taken aback once we entered the room as it was just a 'normal' room. I asked the front desk and was told the hotel was fully occupied. This was our first time facing this and I told her that there should be a way or some way guests should be informed instead of knowing on the actual day itself especially since I booked a week earlier. She

title: Good for overnight stay
desc: Comfortable, clean & quiet room. Good location right near the Expo station, so it allowed a quick trip into town when we arrived and a quick trip back to Changi Airport the next day. Staff were not friendly at all though.

title: Convenient place to go office
desc: Our offoce just next door in the building about 30 steps apart. We stayed here 3 nights and the rooms are small but real comfortable. Like this type of small hotel with easy check in n out. No breakfast provided but can search easily next door. They provide free mobile phone n that was good also.

title: Very good business hotel with great service
desc: Checking in the hotel was easy but you need to give a security deposit aside from your credit card so make sure that you have extra cash. Amenities of the hotel was complete especially if you are travelling for business. The room includes a flat iron and board which is good since I was able to use it for my business attire who got a little wrinkled in my luggage. They also provide a free mobile phone to use with free calls which you can take with you outside. This was very convenient since it has internet access. They also have a water fountain in the room which is part of their advocacy to reduce waste, which is very good, I think, since we all need to reduce our use of plastic and other wastes. Housekeeping is done daily. Staff are nice and courteous. Location is great since

title: Would not go running back...
desc: Despite the "Luxury Hotels" award for 2014 at the reception, they are anything but! When I got to my room after a long flight over from Sydney, the first thing I did was shower. The bath/shower combo is a terrible design that means water flows from the side of the bath, around the back and straight onto the bathroom floor. To add to that inconvenience, the bath drain was super slow, which meant I was forced to stand in used shower water. Not nice. By far, the worst aspect of this hotel is the breakfast. Vouchers for breakfast are for the Yum Cha restaurant across the plaza. This restaurant offers minimal Western breakfast items, but that's not even the biggest problem. They serve food from bain-maries that are left completely uncovered and unsanitary. I personally witnessed

title: A nice hotel with convenient access
desc: This is an upscale hotel located close to the Changi City Point shoppin mall with easy access to affordable food and shopping. It is also close to the MRT station for gettin to other parts of Singapore. It is relatively close to the airport.

title: Good for Stopovers
desc: Was there for a complimentary one night weekend stay. There's nothing fantastic about the hotel, maybe suitable for those who just want to catch a good sleep. On the whole, the room was rather clean and comfortable. Do not expect a great view from the rooms as it is situated within a business district. We could only see industrial/commercial buildings through the glass window. The one man width sized pool at the rooftop was so small that makes it kind of redundant. There are a few restaurants nearby the hotel. Given that it was only a short distance away from the Changi City Point and Expo Mrt Station, i would only recommend this hotel for flight stopovers.

title: Unforgettable Visit
desc: Spent a few nights in the hotel and ever since my family and I arrived we were treated no less than royalty. The stay was rather pleasant as there were a lot of necessities provided and we found that it was really a joy to check-in to the hotel. The ambience and everything else just blended really well. The rooms were large and we actually felt like we were in a second home. Believe me, if I could, I'd stay there all my life. The service was beyond excellent, I'd say. Many thanks to your staff for helping me out whenever I had many questions regarding so many different things. Special thanks to two of your staff, Tasha Singh and Nurul Huda (if I have gotten their names right) for helping me with directions and their absolutely stunning service. Both of them were very

title: Comfort Hotel
desc: This is hotel location at changi business center and very close to airport.. Nice and clean hotel but not cheap, hotel staff very friendly and will help guest if there something want to know.... Only less one thing, menu for breakfast not to much....

title: Staycation
desc: It was really a pleasant and wonderful visit to Park Avenue Changi. Both me and my husband love the room as it was really spacious. The counter staff are all friendly and professional. Would love to come back again.

title: Great service, walking distance to MRT station and shops
desc: I chose this hotel for the Guns N Roses concert which had shuttle bus runs from the Expo station. This hotel is right next to this station. Upon returning late back from the concert, all the restaurants around this hotel were closed but the vending machine in front of the hotel was available but could not accept the local 50 cents coins. The front desk lady was extremely helpful to change for the appropriate coins and accommodate my hunger requests. The Deluxe room is very comfortable, with a large king sized bed, bathtub and quiet set up. Highly recommended

title: Comfortable hotel with nice staff
desc: I used this hotel during a symposium which took place at the SUTD university, really close by. The hotel is located right at the expo mrt stop so you can easily reach the downtown ( you need to transfer twice though). The staff is nice and the beds are comfortable. The bathrooms looked a bit old but everything worked well.

title: very comfortable
desc: A very modern hotel with all modern facilities, including a washing machine. The bed was very comfortable. Good lighting and a good clean bathroom. An easy walk to the SMART station and then to the airport.

title: Clean and modern - very comfortable stay
desc: Pros: 1. Courteous staff 2. Very comfortable room and bed 3. Toiletries had a lovely scent 4. Instead of offering bottled water, each room has a tap to access filtered water - we loved this! Ecological (no plastic) and as much water as we wanted 5. Great water pressure 6. each room has a mobile phone with cellular and data for use anywhere in Singapore while a guest - this was very helpful and we didn't need to get a local SIM Cons: 1. No food (ie room service) and since hotel is located in an office park, no many options for food Would gladly stay here again!

title: great location, one subway stop from the airport
desc: Well located hotel, one MRT stop away from the airport. Room was spacious, good shower, friendly staff. We had an early 8am flight. Staying at this reasonably priced hotel enabled us to save a taxi expense and take the subway to the airport, with plenty of time to spare.

title: Good hotel
desc: Stayed here as a part of a conference in Singapore. The staff were helpful and courteous. Some of our requests for bottle openers and corkscrews were immediately attended to. The pool is small though so if you're a big person that might be a let down. The channels available on the TV are also limited, it was somewhat strange not to have soccer on TV but then that's probably just a cultural difference. Interestingly the room has a drinking water outlet in the bathroom, and they promote refilling bottles to reduce plastic usage, I quite liked this initiative on their part. The hotel is located quite close to the metro station, so if you're staying out all day this is quite convenient.

title: Very good business hotel close to Airport and Changi Business Park
desc: The hotel is a 10 minute drive from the airport and right in the middle of Changi Business Park. To that effect, it is strategically located and very convenient if your trip revolves aorund meetings in that area. If you wish to go to the city or do some sighseeing, you will have to travel out a minimum of 15 kms. The checking process was smooth and the rooms had all the necessary amenities. One of the facilities that was a pleasant surprise was a spare Mobile Phone with 4G connection that one can use while in Singapore. It also offered free international calls to many countries includiing India. So, ideally, one can still manage without taking a local SIM, which is a good thing. The hotel does not have a restaurant and hence it does not offer in-room dining, but there are

title: Greatest hotel stay ever
desc: Check in on 13-15 of January for a friend's wedding held in UE biz east convention hall. First of all u will be greeted warmly by the front desk staff. Staffs there are willing to go the extra mile to help you. Especially Tasha Singh, she's the person we approached for help and we are really impressed by her professionalism. Hotel is really clean. The rooms is cozy. Easily the best hotel stay ever. Thank you park avenue changi.

title: Stop over
desc: The hotel was comfortable and close to the airport and the staff were friendly but....after getting off a late flight and expecting some kind of room service, i was left hungry and thirsty as room service does not exist and there is no bar fridge. Why they put empty fridge in hotel rooms is a mystery to me. Breakfast did not start until 07.00 am so i missed that as my conectinv flight was early that day. Most hotels open breakfast at six, in my experience. I was directed to a 7-11 if wanted food??? From a 7-11....really?? Not good enough. So, hotel was comfortable but thats it...do not expect anything other than an expensive bed. Stay else where if you want service. I wont be coming here again.

title: Excellent Stay
desc: We arrive early and was given the room on the spot. Good service for taking care of your guest. Check was fast and friendly staff. Room a bit small but clean and tidy. Check out was fast and helpful to take us a taxi. Luggage was assisted properly by bellboy! Thank you and definitely will come back again. Wonderful service front front office team.

title: Nice hotel for Business Trips
desc: Comfortable rooms.Gym available.Pool though available but of no use as it is too small.No dining facility available.Walking distance from Changi business park.Front desk staff are very cordial.very near to Expo (MRT) station,2mins walking

title: Great location (near MRT, Shopping Mall, NTUC, Food), Clean & Comfy Bed
desc: Hotel: Location is very near Expo MRT (less than 8 min walk) but there is no sheltered walkway from MRT to the hotel and currently you have to walk on the road in between the ongoing minor road work/ constructions. There is no in-house restaurant but it is of no problem since it is very near to NTUC Xtra and restaurants at UE Biz Hub (less than 5 min walk and with shelter) as well as Changi City Point but you have to walk back on the same road to it as there is no shortcut as of now. I like the hotel's security as you need to use your hotel card in order to use their lift (plus point: they have 3 lifts so you don't have to wait too long). The hotel card will expire upon the check-out time. There is a small lap pool and gym on the top floor (10th floor). Room (1 bedroom suite):

title: Good business hotel near airport
desc: Stay for business trip, the hotel is very close to hotel (one MRT station away), room was clean and bed was firm. There're several mall and supermarket near by including Changi City Point and Fairprice supermarket, as well as restaurant which open very early but close early as well. WiFi is fast, my only complain is that they don't provide bottled water but filter water in-room, might not be familiar to some.

title: Good business hotel near Changi Business park and airport
desc: A good business hotel in the heart of the Changi Business Park. The hotel is very close to the Expo MRT station as well and a short taxi ride from the Airport. I stayed here for 4 days during Feb 2016. I loved the room with it's modern decor and the stylish bathroom. The complimentary breakfast is served in a nearby restaurant which is a tad disappointing and makes you think that the tariff is high. The breakfast spread has limited choice and the restaurant played the same loud music everyday.

title: 6 night stay for business conference
desc: Park avenue Changi is a well appointed hotel for short stay. I was arranged to stay for 6 nights at this hotel by the organisers of my conference in January 2017. Check in was very smooth and a suite was given to me. A friendly porter then bought our bags up to our room. All the staff that we have encountered during our stay were very friendly and professional. The room is well furnished for short term stay. It has a small kitchenette complete with hot plate stoves and a microwave oven. A small fridge/freezer is also provided. Most impressively, a washing machine equipped with dryer was also in the suite for your laundry. Bedding was excellent and there is a pillow menu for you to choose from ranging from memory to contour pillows. This is idea for individuals like myself who

title: Great Weekend getaway
desc: Stayed over the weekend ph period. Booked for the 1 bedroom suite. The room was awesome... For ma hub n I we find it quite big for sg hotels... Shopping mall for a 5 mins walk was enuf to get wat u nid.. There's nearby ntuc as well for out stock... The counter service was awesome... They responded to our queries very pomptly(as we asked qns on diff days like tourists.. haha). Did not managed to get their names thou... The bell boy that talks to us wen we was smoking downstairs was nice(forget his names, he was on night shift on 23rd dec).. Liase with the management as we r celebrating our anniversary, I am pleased with the arrangement by Fred & team on the fruit basket & the cake... Thank you guys...

title: Great place to stay. Excellent hospitality
desc: Firstly, I would like to thank all the hotel staff for giving me a warm welcome. Secondly one of the front desk named Natasha the indian girl was very helpful. Because i lost my luggage at the airport with my important stuff in it. But she did an excellent job. By contacting the airport personally trying to get me back my luggage. She even called me on my mobile phone when they manage to find my luggage back. Really am thankful she went an extra mile to help. Will return on my next visit. And will recommend some other business partners.

title: Decent hotel
desc: Husband staying here in business for a couple of months so, myself and daughter joined him for Christmas. Is located near airport, but not near city and tourist areas, however there is a metro station a couple of minutes walk away. We had a standard room on the 8th floor. Had TV, fridge,kettle tea/ coffee decent wardrobe space, large comfy bed. They put another single bed in for our daughter. Bathroom is a good size,good shower over the bath. It included a special tap with filtered drinking water, nice idea. A smart phone was included in the room with free calls and maps. We used it once but the battery went flat. Good for phoning home.pool on the roof is small, there are 3 loungers up there. There are washers and driers at Singapore $7 each. The re was a huge storm the night

title: Business Trip - Excellent Stay
desc: I stayed here for 6 days and 5 nights for a business trip. Our regional office in Singapore was a 5-10 minute walk from Park Changi and 5 minute ride from the airport. I got a standard room on a high floor, it was well-lit and loved the interior design. Staff members were very accommodating. They served a buffet-type breakfast at a restaurant right beside the hotel. The hotel itself was easily accessible as it was near a supermarket (literally across the hotel), mall and a train station. Will definitely be back!

title: Simple stay
desc: Probably for layover and business travellers in this Business Park. Near to a train station and a shopping mall, one will never get hungry. Decent gym and a small pool which can only accommodate for 2 swimmers. Breakfast is served at next door dim sum restaurant which prices are a bit steep. Room is clean and small, Fast and efficient check in and check out.There's nothing to boast about but a simple stay.

title: Ideal for a short trip
desc: I bought this on groupon (the executive suite). The first impression was good. It's clean, equipped with most things. However, we had to pay $23 for carpark charges as the staff wasn't clear with instructions on parking rates despite being asked several times. It could have been more directive or offer complimentary parking. There was a party in the rooms above us, we could hear noises up till 3am.

title: Good Accomodation for layover
desc: 10$ taxi ride from airport, good sized rooms and comfy bed, however no food services available. Staff were helpful and order my taxi. Not quite a family hotel, more suited for layovers and bussiness trips in my opinion.

title: Decent staycation
desc: Booked a weekend staycation with the winning bid on qoo10.sg. Booked a Executive Deluxe room from that. The hotel is located at Changi, which is near Singapore Expo MRT station and Changi City Point. The venue is great for a short stopover for foreigner as it is near the airport. Many great food, retail shops, supermarkets, gym etc are a stone throw away. The room was spacious, with a dining table in the living room, a bedroom, a toilet and a washing machine. These facilities resembles a residence/flat/house and hence the name. The hotel do not provide breakfast as there is no restaurant in the hotel. Everything was great till we went to the swimming pool at the rooftop. The swimming pool was so small that i changed my mind to swim. The gym is big and more enticing than the

title: Small room size but close to MRT and Changi Mall
desc: The hotel does not have restaurant facility. Guests have to walk to a nearby restaurant for free breakfast. The hotel is very efficient. It is good for business trip not a family trip. Close to a mall and many restaurant. Walking distance to MRT Station.

title: Ideal for Expo & Business Park
desc: Stayed here for a night as I had to work early in the vicinity for an event. The hotel is relatively new and almost of the furnishings in the room were brand new. The bed was comfortable, with good pillows. Amenities could also be found in the bathroom. The wardrobe was good-sized. The open concept of the bathroom made the room quite spacious. There are a few cons to the room: - The bathroom has an open glass panel, which can be a privacy issue for those who are not comfortable with their friends/other half. - There isn't a power plug in the bathroom, hence I could not use the hair dryer in there. I had to stand elsewhere in the room. I noticed there wasn't a shaver switch in the bathroom too. - There was no charging outlets for USBs, neither an available electric outlet

title: Only worth the money because I got it at a discounted price
desc: Bought a staycation deal on qoo10.sg for a 1 night stay at the Executive Deluxe room. Checking in was quick and staff was friendly. However, when asked if we can get a late checkout the next day (as described as "subject to availability upon date of departure" on the booking email), we were told to enquire the next morning. We found it quite strange as most hotels will be able to inform you the day before check out. The room was spacious, and comes with a kitchenette and a washing machine. There is no mini bar, but a fridge is provided. It seems like housekeeping do not clean up the fridge - there was a weird smell coming out of the fridge, and packets of ice that were left behind for god knows how long. Utensils and cutlery were provided in the kitchenette. The downside is no

title: Stay only if you are not allergic or sensitive
desc: I chosen this hotel because I wanted a bathtub and close to my home. To soak my stress away from moving. The place is relatively new and the down side is the room is build in carpet hence, we notice there was a strong perfume smell. The room is clean, tidy and neat. We went up to the pool, a lap pool only catering for one person. We used the pool at 2pm right after I checked in. For some reason, I had fallen very ill after that ten min. of swim that I had to leave at 9+ pm paying the full amount and go home. My husband was also ill. I am unsure if the pool water is cleaned but I saw algae. I didn't have breakfast non lunch so I am unsure what it is really. Vomited badly and was shivering with cold in the room. The air condition at highest can be set at 25degree Celsius of which

title: Young helpful staff
desc: I recently stayed here to attend a medical international meeting. The park avenue hotel was very simple clean and the rooms were very small. You won't have much room to put things away. If you get a room with a king bed you will have less room!! The best thing about this hotel is the location near everything especially the metro. Nd the best service. The staff is young and extremely accommodating. The main help to us, Mohammed was kind and would have done anything to help us during our stay. Both Fin and Fang (that is their names) were kind and also did everything they could to make our stay great and comfortable. The attached restaurant was okay but reasonable and were were again very close to the metro. Singapore was expensive and this hotel although with small rooms

title: Perfect Value-for-Money Stopover
desc: Very good, clean, modern, quiet hotel relatively close to Changi Airport. Based on our very pleasant stay, I'd say it's been somewhat Under-rated by some reviewers both here and on booking.com. Yep, no restaurant, breakfast room or bar ... and yes that is a negative. But still one of the best value-for-money hotels near the Airport - especially if, like us, you're on a one night stopover with long haul flights both the day before and day after. Rooms were Comfortable, spacious and, pleasingly, rather more 'upmarket' than the hotel's on-line shots suggest - including a bath which was great after a long flight. The large internal window between bathroom and bedroom seems to have freaked out one or two reviewers. But there is a curtain that you can pull down and I assume the

title: Average business hotel
desc: I have stayed in this hotel during my visit to Singapore. I would say the location is good if you work in CBP. Rooms are tiny. No complementary breakfast. Wifi is relatively slow. Expensive for the facilities they provide. You can choose this hotel for short trips if work in CBP.

title: Convenient for the Business Park, but not so good.
desc: I was in Singapore on a business trip for around 10 days, and even if it was close to the airport and to the business park, the hotel was very average! First of all, it didn't count with any kind of restaurant, neither served breakfast. My room was average, I requested a double bed or at least a medium size one, but I only got a room with two single small beds. The views from the fitness room at the roof are nice and the pool is refreshing but it's way to narrow and short.

title: luxurious and conveniently located hotel
desc: The service, location, amenities were exceptional. Free use of smartphone/wifi allowed us to contact family 12 time zones away for free and find out about local activities and tourist destinations. I especially recommend their breakfast service with the room as the dining room, food, and chef and wait staff are very good. Great location for folks that love to watch the airplanes take off and land. Also, wonderful for early morning flights.

title: convinient location for business traveller. close to MRT too
desc: has a service apt concept for most rooms so there is space which is luxury in Singapore. Breakfast at the restaurant is stricly functional but nothing to complain. Finish your dinnner early as the area gets deserted (boring) late evening onwards. But he MRT can take you places

title: excellent hotel near Changi
desc: Very accommodating staff. Bright, comfortable and, for Singapore, roomy hotel that is one train stop away from Changi. It would be nice if the hotel would add a shuttle service to the terminals as other nearby hotels do. This property seems geared less to the traveler and more to extended stay business folks who are meeting at Expo. There are no dining facilities in the hotel, but plenty of places to eat nearby.

title: Simple and No Fuss
desc: I made a booking there for a staycation with my hubby during his recent birthday. I have informed the hotel to give me a nice room if occupancy permits so that I can give my hubby a much deserving treat on his big day. After all, it's our first trip away from our 4 yo since we became parents. The room was alright except that it's a little dim. We have brought our family to another hotel next door so we have kind of set our expectation...too high perhaps. A little disappointed that there was no sweet gesture extended to my hubby like perhaps a little birthday card or small cake. Perhaps I have been spoilt by the other hotels we went to. A request for a later checkout time was also a little challenging. Hence we left at 11am the next day, without spending a full 20 or 24 hours at

title: Very convenient for work in Changi Business Park and 5-min to airport
desc: Stayed here twice recently on my biz trips with clients in the Changi Business Park area. A short walk from the Expo MRT and next to Changi City Point mall and Fairprice Tesco supermarket. Staff very friendly. Wifi is stable with good speed. They even provide an Infocus handset which you can take along during your stay in Singapore that provides unlimited local calls and Internet surfing.

title: Review of hotel
desc: Hotel very close to Changi Airport. Close to local shopping complex and walking distance to offices. After initial hiccup, I got a great room upgrade and very happy with the hotel. Manager / staff very approachable and helpful. Suite is very comfortable, great bed and pillows. Separate living area and great air conditioning for a great nights sleep. Good restaurants in close proximity.

title: Business Effective
desc: Location is great, specially if you have very late and very early arrival/departure. This hotel is a 10 minute taxi ride from airport. It is clean, efficient, reasonably priced and helpful staff. A hotel for business travelers, efficient and clean. Loved the amenities, especially smartphone to use locally and make international calls (for free!!). The hotel does not have a restaurant, but the offerings next door are great. Vegetarian Indian cuisine, Mediterranean, Japanese, Chinese, all at 50 ft proximity.

title: Decent hotel very close to the Airport
desc: Decent business hotel close to the airport with decent facilities. However if one needs to travel to the main center of Singapore best is to go by road instead of public transport. Supermarket is available nearby for basic daily amenities.

title: Blown away by the value add
desc: The hotel is good - Ok for the price. A lot of people have complained about the fact that there is no attached restaurant - the hotel relies on an arrangement with outside shops i.e. Anand Bhavan and Yum Cha for providing complimentary breakfast. But the one thing that blew me away was that the hotel gave me a smartphone for use during my period of stay, including free international calls! For a guest who had just landed in the country, this was just perfect. I'd recommend the hotel for international business travelers.

title: Simple, sufficient, convenient... meets the basic needs for short business trip
desc: Stayed in this hotel for 4D3N during my business trip to Singapore. My experience can be summarized as below: What's impressive: - Hotel located right in the middle of Changi Business Park within walking distance to most offices. - Free WiFi coverage throughout the hotel. - Easy access to food (mall with combination of Asian, Western, just across the hotel - 1 mins walking distance) - Bistros and pubs within 5 mins walking distance from hotel for night life. (Changi City Point mall) - The hypermarket (Fairprice) is just across the hotel if you wish to purchase groceries. - Plenty of Factory Outlet Stores in Changi City Point mall 5 mins walk from the hotel if you would like to purchase goods at relatively reasonable price. - Hotel provides one (1x) complimentary handy

title: Room and service are top, breakfast isn't it
desc: The room is very modern and quite nice. If you shutdown the AC than it is very silent. A cool feater is the window to the bathroom, no fear there is a shade you can close if you want. The trip by taxi to changi airport ist realy short. In the evening we paid 15 SGD and back in the morning 10 SGD. the breakfast is not in the same facility of the hotel. It is in a restaurant across the place. It is small und the offer is it too.

title: Left ill, management denies smoke issues
desc: This is not a non-smoking hotel. We changed rooms many times because of problems with smoke. Outside of this hotel, my health is fine. Inside, I was becoming more and more ill, suffering acute symptoms. Staff cannot do anything about people smoking in the building and I'm fairly certain that people smoke more than just cigarettes. Many of the staff smoke; there was no understanding of the health issues relating to smoke and perhaps management prefers smoking clientele over non-smokers. Whenever we talked to staff, we were told that our problems did not exist.

title: Okay types. But convenient from airport. Clean and decent
desc: This hotel is very near to the airport. And right in the hub of business Changi business hub. Just a walk away from the MRT station. They don't have any room service. Nor they have any own restaurant. They give breakfast coupons for the restaurants located on besides the reception. For breakfast, there are 2 options for restaurants- one is Chinese, and other is south Indian. So a good news for the vegetarians. Nice clean hotel. All facilities in the room.

title: Most helpful
desc: We arrived very early after a 13 hour flight from London and the gentleman at the front desk gave us our room immediately. So kind. The checkout time was noon so we had plenty of time to recover. We had a king room with kitchenette which was superb. Mall and supermarket within easy walk.

title: Poor service, not clean
desc: My company contracted this hotel for all staff who attended the seminar. The service was poor - the bell staff left his post unattended so I had to carry all the luggage myself. I booked the room with a king size bed and the hotel confirmed the request. But it turned out to be two singles pushed together. The hotel was new but poorly maintained. The bathroom was all moldy. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. For those who need to stay in the same area, there is a nearby hotel, Capri by Fraser whose pricings are in the same range but offers clean facilities and much better service.

title: Great
desc: We got a free upgrade to a beautiful spacious room en suite. Very good beds and premium drinkwater from the tap! Even a washing machine in the room and a complete kitchen. Nice and helpfull staff. Restaurant and bar outside the hotel on short walking distance.

title: Nice hotel near the Expo and Changi Airport
desc: The main reason I chose this property is because of its proximity to the Expo, where I attended the Singapore Air Show (February 2016). The taxi had difficulty searching for this hotel. I took the taxi from Changi Airport, as opposed to taking the train. Since my flight got it late, I had difficulty getting some food because the hotel does not offer and in house room service facility. They do have room service options but from external outlets, which closes early. Aside from this problem, there isn't any issue. The room is big and the air conditioning system is working properly. The Expo station is within walking distance and the nearby outlet shop is a good place to visit.

title: Excellent Service and Thumbs Up
desc: We arrive early and was given a room on the spot.....excellent impression to start. Reception check in was fast and efficient. Room was clean and convenient. Pool small but nice and check out was very quick and excellent service from front office staff!!....Thumbs Up Guys!!....highly recommended staff service !!....

title: Overnight Stay
desc: This is a conveniently located hotel. A short taxi ride S$10-15. This is a a basic hotel with some new tech features, like a complimentary Samsung smart phone free to use while staying. There is no restaurant, coffee shop or lobby area so you cross the courtyard to a restaurant across the courtyard for breakfast, this place is not good, hygiene is questionable. There is a shopping center nearby with take away and some restaurants. Overall this hotel is ok for overnight for business but not a long term stay.

title: Nice hotel nearby airport
desc: 7 minutes from the airport. Stayed Deluxe room and it was nice, cozy room with a lot of amenities. However, it would have been better if hairdryer was provided in the room and i did not see any room service menu. The staff was very friendly and service for check in and out was very fast and hassle free. I called for cab on 2 occasions and it arrived within 2 minutes. The frontline staff took the effort to let me know that the cab has arrived and even went to the entrance to open the cab door for me. Very pleased with the service and would definitely stay here again.

title: Good transit hotel for an overnight stay
desc: Had an 18 hour layover in Singapore , we chose this hotel because it was close to the airport and Mrt to get into Singapore. We had a twin room and was similar in layout to a premier inn or travel lodge.its very close to the Expo Mrt and easy to get into town for all the major attractions. There is breakfast included in the price at a local restaurant which is just across the path. There are many places to eat , a bar and a very large supermarket nearby. The rooms were very clean and well equipped and the beds really comfortable , we would definitely use again for an overnight stay highly recommended hotel

title: Great stay....
desc: Room was clean and staffs were very friendly. Walking distance to Singapore Expo Hall. Near to train station. Free wifi. We were upgraded to suite room with kitchen net and washing machine. They provide us with Infocus phone called handy which exceed our expectation. It is specially helpful for us without roaming assess to get connected always. Great stay. Will definitely stay here again if we are around Changi area again.

title: Best Bed!
desc: This is the first hotel I have seen that has premium drinking water faucet in the room, and their beds are so comfortable I had the most restful sleep in a hotel here! The staff are very friendly and the location is so close to the expo where we attended a congress with so many restaurants, cafe, shops, grocery and an outlet mall around. The MRT is also just a few steps away.

title: Great
desc: Stayed for two night at a stop over. Great hotel. Rooms large and restaurants amazing.Great value for money and perfect for a healthy option breakfast. I would defintely return. Staff are so helpful & professional. Hight recomment this hotel.

title: Great business hotel
desc: If you're working in Changi Business Park (CBP) or nearby area, even in airport there is no better option than this place. Rooms : clean and tidy, cozy and just perfect size. Every room is equipped with tv, fridge coffee maker, hair dryer and surprise surprise Iron and iron board!!!! Staff: extremely courteous and ready to help for anything. Location : Now this is where this hotel excels and stands tall. This hotel is right in middle of CBP with plenty of eateries. Just 2 minutes walk for Expo MRT station, a minute walk from mall. If you are new in Singapore, then this is the place to be in. Cons: This is not a con but this is only a business hotel, if you are visiting Singapore for leisure holiday then this is not for you.

title: for short settling was a relaxing
desc: nice hotel, very clean, very comfortable beds, bathroom nice , friendly staff, You can stay relax. Location to MRT and mall a big advantage. Near the airport. The environment is quiet . Service from the desk is awesome. There wasnt much hassle in checking in and things were done quickly

title: Welcoming. Beautiful reception.
desc: We were treated like special guests. We were given meal vouchers and other surprise treats. A beautiful room, and a swimming pool with wonderful views over the water, from the rooftop. I loved the fitness room as it included an area for yoga. The restaurant with the ding areas outside was perfect. We particularly enjoyed the bar in the evening. Charlie was an excellent bartender. Thanks

title: Perfect for businnes
desc: Stayed there for 9 days. It is very close to metro (MRT) and also was 5 minutes walk from business. Clean, quietness in the rooms, very good wifi. Impressed by Handy a mobile given to you for free for as long as you stay there, so its easy to hang around the city use apps like maps and don't worry for the cost of roaming. Another plus the tap with drinking water. I would gladly stay here again.

title: Staycation - 2nd Stay!
desc: Our second last minute staycation 3D2N (15 to 17 July) at Park Avenue Changi Hotel. We checked in on Friday evening and was greeted by Teddy. Check in process was a bit slow. Anyway we really appreciate the kind gesture from the duty manager, Helmi for the upgraded room. We really had an enjoyable stay and the room was so much different from the first time we stayed in. We were really disappointed about the closed swimming pool. I had actually wanted to bring my daughter for a swim. No information about the pool was given during checked in. It would have been great if there was a notice on the front desk so that we would not have found out only after going to the top floor with our swimming suit. :) Thank you Natasha for the ticket upon check out.

title: Executive Deluxe Room
desc: The room is awesome. There is also a drinking water tap, which helps to reduce the trouble of bottled water. The room is also complete with washing machine, dryer, microwave oven and an electric cooker stove. It is a non-smoking hotel and just 2 minutes walk to Changi City Point and MRT station. A very convenient location. The pool is tiny though, you cant swim if one person is already swimming. The staff are alright, but needs to be more professional and minimize speaking or giggling too loud each time the guests walks away.

title: close to airport and also some nice restaurants
desc: pros:- -close to airport and also some nice restaurants. -rooms are decent size. -they also have washing machine, microwave etc. con: -No breakfast (but they provide coupons and either chinese or indian restaurant is just outside the hotel)

title: Perfect Hotel
desc: A great stay in a suite room with quick check in. friendly and helpful staffs. NTUC and other shops mins away. Everything was smooth. Room was clean. Bed was so comfortable. Parking rate is reasonable too. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Yay!

title: Nice hotel with very comfy bed
desc: Hotel is very nice - modern, clean and tasteful. Bed is very comfy which is important. The bathroom is very amusing to me as there is a large window where you can look in from the bed - unfortunately I am travelling solo! Close to the airport so good for early morning flights from Singapore.

title: Great Hotel for Business Travelers
desc: Close to airport and many multi-national companies. About 30 restaurants within a 5 min walk and a grocery store within 1 min walk. Train station less than 1 block. Very modern and new. Comfortable bed and very clean. Connected to the convention center.

title: Feels gooooooood
desc: Best place to stay if you work at or around changi business park Only boring thing is traveling into the city from changi. Expo is a place near the hotel if getting bored we can roam there food , fair price, everything is around here over all best selection

title: A great staying experience again!
desc: The stay at Park Ave Changi was an overall great one, except that the gym and swimming pool were closed during my stay due to a crack on the glass window. Like what I have mentioned in my previous review, the serenity of the premises, bath tub etc were some of the reasons for me to be a returning guest. Another new reason that I like this hotel is the relax chair in the room. One can sit on it to write, read, watch TV or simply enjoy the view. The room is also spacious enough for me to do my yoga. If you are a traveller who wants to recharge and rejuvenate, this hotel is for you. Please keep up the good work and I look forward to use the gym and swimming pool during my next visit! Room tips: Ask for higher floor and facing the circle sky garden (the other side is facing the

title: Convenient Stay with many dining options
desc: Booked Park Avenue Changi to try out for my Staycation on 7th August. Requested for late check out, they offered till 1pm still need to call and check. Doesn't really feel the warm welcome of guest when step in, but it doesn't matters anyway. Had spent $170 to booked their superior rm, the room size was only 23sqm.. smaller compared to Capri by Fraser. I wanted a bathtub for shower so I chosen this place. It was a "Mini" bathtub. If someone has long legs they won't be able to stretch their legs out. The toilet seat cover tilted sideway when I sat on it.. Need to do maintenance for it.. No bathrobe provided in cabinet only bedroom slippers. TV CHANNELs were limited. The bed was comfortable to sleep on with 4 pillows. A Comfortable couch sofa for 1 good for lying and

title: Pleasant stay
desc: Its neat with gentle services in a great environment to have peace with. I there is a thing to improve it would be food services/restaurant for themselves. Had to have breakfast in other restaurants nearby when late.

title: Great overall experience!
desc: I would still rate it 5 star overall although it does not provide everything a normal 5 star hotel does, for me, the accommodation, the room and experience was smooth and worth the money. A regular 5 star suite cost x2 this hotel so you can't expect an excellent service. I was checked in by a soft spoken, probably foreigner lady (definitely not local) on the 16th July at about 1pm. There were 2 staff only on duty and the other staff was attending to another guests. As my family and I walked in, I expected her to attend to me immediately upon noticing our entry but I waited for a good 1 minute before the security had to tell her that I am there and to attend to me. That was a bad service impression on such a nicely ambient hotel, she doesn't smile either. The one bedroom suite

title: Great Executive Suite
desc: The Suite come with a king size bed and a sofa bed. A fully equipped and functional kitchen (with all the utensils available). A cosy and nice atmosphere. only downside was the location and the swimming pool. its very small.

title: Great Place to Stay with Early Check-In
desc: Had an early flight into Singapore and an early flight out the next day. The transit hotel was not an option as I wanted to leave the airport. And the Crowne Plaza at the airport is terrible about early check-ins. So I picked the Park Avenue, as they will guarantee an early check-in for $30. I got through immigration at 7 AM and walked over to the MRT. For $1.50, I took the MRT to the Expo station, the first station from the airport. It was early and dark, and when I got to Expo, it was deserted. But hey,m this is Singapore, so I did not feel unsafe. There is construction, but signage makes it easy to find your way. I was able to check in at 7:30 and got to my room, which was a 1-bedroom suite with a kitchenette. Very nice and well-appointed. The grocery store is steps

title: Like a 5 star executive room
desc: My executive deluxe room is super nice. Super comfortable bed! Clean bathroom, actually everything is clean! Very spacious room. For me one of the best serviced hotel in Singapore. It's very convenient as it is near my office. Super comfortable stay! Definitely recommend it!

title: Phenomenal
desc: Great stay. Very comfortable beds, air conditioning was a breeze to fine tune and get just right! The lovely receptionist even helped me to my room when I had trouble with my bags. Fridge was good and empty. View was of an extremely boring construction site but I didn't care :) Grocery store nearby was handy and an easy walk to the Expo station, even with bags. They even had a free phone for guest use (with data too I think), but I didn't use it so can't say for sure. Highly recommend for a relaxing stay. Checkout was quick and easy :)

title: Very nice hotel
desc: my company usually books us at this hotel whenever we have business trip to singapore. it's really nice and clean and the amenities are great. staff are super friendly. one time i got the colds and i requested for a couple more bottles of water, they gave me 10!!! :) it felt really good to know they care even if it's just a bottle of water. pool was always clean and the gym was OK. it's also close to a mall and MRT and airport.

title: an ordinary business hotel
desc: you'd probably want to stay here if 1. you need to stay very near the changi airport and cannot afford a room at crowne plaza, or 2. there is some business function at singapore expo/changi business park you need to attend to. the hotel is a distance away from town and rest of the civilisation to make it attractive to the typical tourist. rooms are typical of hotels, size decent, have most items you'd need. i like that they have the handy phone which offers free local phone calls and info on singapore. this is especially useful for the overseas guest who don't wish to buy a sim card for a 1,2 day stopover in singapore. no in house restaurant so breakfast is served by a nearby cafe. my window faced the mrt tracks and hotel is now partially blocked by a construction site so

title: Excellent
desc: I stayed at this hotel for 3 night. Studio room was well services-clean comfortable and bright. Interestingly the bathroom wall has glass panel which you can see into the bedroom. Breakfast is serviced at the adjacent yum cha restaurant facing the hotel. Short walk to Expo MRT station which is next to the outlet mall -Changi Point Mall. Plenty of food around the hotel. Including supermarket [Fair Price] if you need any essentials. Staff are very helpful. I would recommend as airport hotel, it's only 10-15 mins.

title: Nice Executive Suite
desc: The suite has a king size bed and a sofa bed. The room layout is good as it has a proper working desk where I was able to do my work while my family watched TV in the living room. The swimming pool is very small and there is no kids pool. The front desk staff (a young man) told us that the parking is $45 per day. It almost ruin our day as we felt that it was too steep for a hotel in the suburbs. (In fact, parking should be free.) At around 2 pm, I called the front desk and a lady told me that the parking fee was $6.50.

title: Everything I needed was here! Great for my business trip!
desc: My stay was excellent. I was here for business and everything I needed was provided. From the elegant, clean, comfortable room, to the outlet for my US computer, they have thought of everything! And the MRT is steps away, I was able to connect to anywhere in Singapore. Thanks you management and staff for a wonderful stay. I will stay again.

title: Perfect position for Expo or Convention Centre. ..
desc: Perfect location.. easy walking distance to the Expo and Convention Centre and also the train takes you to the city one way and 1 stop to the airport the other. Hotel was nice and tidy... and in floors 5 up they provided mobile phones with free internet which our friends on the 7th floor raved about but alas we were on the 4th floor ao didnt get one.. not sure why however rhe hotel was very obliging in allowing a late check out at 2pm the day we left.

title: Superb stay
desc: Was here for 5 days business trip. Really nice hotel. Room is excelent condition. They provide free smartphone for guest in the room! With internet data so you don't need to buy local sim card, really handy! In the next building there's lots of restaurants. You should try to sushi zanmai there It's 7 mins walk to my customer office so really good and I can get extra rest time.

title: Still alright
desc: Had a staycation yesterday from Groupon. Check in was good and fast. Was a kind bedroom suite. Room was pretty small. Stayed at Capri before which was nearby and also has a kitchenette but distinctively different in size. Tv's remote in living room was super faulty. Have to press like super hard for the channel to change. And iPod dock was not plugged in at all which we have a hard time getting it to work. Didn't use the amenities as its a one day stay. Bed was comfy. Bathtub was super small. Toilet was small too. Walk to mrt was 5-8mins and have to make a detour due to the construction going on around. Decided to cook breakfast for the mister and asked for dishwashing detergent which website stated would be provided upon request. I called up front desk asking for it

title: Good for BTMICE and Transit Travellers
desc: Had to make a long detour due to current MRT construction. From existing Expo MRT Station, it’s a 10mins walk to the hotel. If you have a luggage, might be slightly inconvenient. Check-in was quick given that my flight touched down Singapore near 9pm at night. Room at 3rd floor with windows facing the UE Convention Centre. Small room, even small wardrobe and even smaller bathtub. Booked a Deluxe King, but it seems like 2 single beds joined together in a Superior Room. Definitely a mismatch of expectations to room descriptions (based on agoda’s website).
