Instead of blanket sizes that drapes over the side of the bed, the blanket given was small and sits at the top of the bed perfectly (end up pulling and tugging over the blanket during sleep at night). We were too tired to request

title: Perfect for attending a convention
desc: We are having convention for 3 days at the EXPO. I chose this hotel because of the walking distance to the EXPO. It is only next to Changi MRT station. You can go anywhere in Singapore from that station. The room are nice and spacious. Everything looks new. It's perfect for a business trip. There are also plenty of Halal food on the opposite building next to the MRT. Its a small shopping complex. As Muslim traveller going to Singapore, this is a place to stay. Just below the hotel on the same level with the hotel lobby, there's a supermarket. You need to pay parking fees if you are driving here. Its an affordable fee. For my purpose of stay, I truly love this hotel.

title: Great hotel close to the airport in si gapore
desc: This hotel is located at the business park next to the Expo MRT. This is out fourth stay at the hotel and the staff are friendly and recognize us. There are studios, one bedroom and about 10 2 bedroom suites. We have stayed every time in the two bedroom suites which need to be booked well in advance since they are so few. There is a kitchenette in the room along with a washer dryer combo. There is a grocery store across the plaza so you can pick up some food. There is also a mall (Changi Point) which provides lots of food options.

title: Good business place to stay
desc: Good place to stay as it's near changi airport and next to the train station. Only thing is that eatables joints near by close very early and leaving no options to eat as this hotel in in business park.

title: "Good for convention"
desc: I had two nights in Singapore with an early morning flight scheduled for KL on the 3rd day so I elected to stay here rather than downtown ( money was also a factor ) this was my 3rd trip to Singapore so I knew what I wanted to do. By American standards this a 3 1/2 to 4 star hotel, the room is clean and the size was ok. There is a market with a huge variety of anything you could possibly need 100 yards from the lobby. There are many restaurants nearby which serve mostly local cuisine. The train station (SMRT) is a 5-10 minute walk. The subways in Singapore are clean and very safe I bought a 3 day pass at the airport for about $25 U.S. dollars. As far as things to do I recommend the Marina Sands skywalk which offers a fantastic view of the city, if your traveling with children

title: Unfriendly Staff at the Frontdesk
desc: My family and I were there from 16-17 April 2016. The only complain we had is the bad customer service at the frontdesk. Unwelcoming and not friendly. It was a Malay and Indian lady which showed us some attitude. Gotta improve on the customer service in your hotel. Im not the kinda customer who expects so much but probably a smile and a simple greeting would brighten up the guests day. Other than tt, technician was fine when we called in and when he came, we told him of the aircon problem tt we had. He resolved it. Room was very nice and comfortable. I'd rate 4.5/5 for room, but 1/5 for customer service at frontdesk.

title: Convenience
desc: Comfortable and clean hotel. Great place to stay if you are attending an exhibition as it is right next door so you will not need to cram into the MRT, or wait in long lines to get a taxi or the shuttle bus back into the city. There's a shopping center next door which includes an NTUC supermarket, and an MRT station which is only one stop away from Changi airport.

title: Mixed bag
desc: Technology is used liberally in the hotel. But it had too many problems. Room key card worked erratically in the lifts. The IPTV was painfully slow and complicated. The smartphone refused to show a simple display with a keypad. The wifi was very painful to configure on the Android phone and simply refused to work. You get very very frustrated, very quickly. Rooms had a refreshing green theme based decor. But they were small. No space even for a luggage rack. There is no water to drink in the small gym. The bed was so short that I had to sleep diagonally. Finally, breakfast arrangements were made with an Indian restaurant nearby, that served up the same menu for all the days. Pray, why do they assume that all guests, want to eat this.

title: Comfortable stopover
desc: This modern hotel is situated in a business park, within easy reach of Singapore's Changi airport. It was ideal for a short stopover. The room was spacious, very well appointed, everything one wanted. There was a MRT station 5 minutes walk. Also a well stocked supermarket and several eateries, including a Swiss coffee shop (delicious pastries) around the corner. A visit to the Changi Museum and seafront is not too far away.

title: Good hotel
desc: Only spent one night and had no time to check out the facilities but bed was good and had restful sleep. About S$13 by taxi from airport during the night. Day time taxi was a little less to the airport. Nice fixtures and fittings.

title: Quick stay in Singapore
desc: Very clean and comfortable room at a great price for Singapore. I was just passing through Singapore and needed a room near the airport and didn't want to spend a ton of money. This hotel exceeded my expectations. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to help. I will stay here again.

title: One of the most completed hotel
desc: Love the fact that my room had a kitchenette, a washing machine, 2 tvs and a living room. Feels like I'm at my own home. The view was nice, although it is just buildings. Only stayed for a night from a Groupon voucher but this is definitely a hotel to visit again.

title: Good Value close to airport
desc: The Park Avenue is about a 5 minute taxi ride from the Caangi airport and is a particularly convenient location for those arriving late at night. Check in was fast and the room pleasant. Having a bath was particularly appreciated after a long flight. Breakfast was at a restaurant across from the hotel reception. The MRT Expo Station is a five minute walk from the hotel. This would also be an excellent location for those with early morning flights. The Changi airport is one stop away but unless one is traveling light or familiar with the MRT, taking a taxi is probably the best way to reach the hotel.

title: Close to airport / different
desc: Hotel overall was average, close to the airport and conference centre. Our room was a little different, the bathroom within the room had a full clear window so whilst sitting on the bed you have a view of whatever is going on in the bathroom - very different - whilst I'm open minded I think this should be frosted glass for a bit of privacy.. Breakfast was outside the hotel at another location- service here was poor as was the breakfast. So for those travelling, get up have a coffee and go to the airport to get breakfast. I wouldn't recommend paying extra for theirs.

title: A great place for retreat, staycation or transit
desc: I stayed at Park Avenue Changi for 1 night for my personal retreat. It is located within a business Park in the eastern part of Singapore. What I like most about this hotel is the prompt service at the front desk and the cleanliness and tranquility the room. The room size is much bigger than those from downtown, despite paying lesser. An added bonus would be the bathtub, which is not common for hotels of similar price range. There are a few eateries/restaurants (do take note that quite a few do not open on weekends as they serve mainly the office workers who work on weekdays) and a supermarket (opens 8am to 1030pm daily) within the walking distance. There is a shopping centre nearby (Changi City Point) that offers much more dining and shopping options. However, due to the

title: Good for the expo
desc: Stayed on the 7th floor for 6 nights during FHA. The room was a good size and very clean. All the fittings worked and it had good wifi. The bed very nice and firm and very comfortable. The power points were multinational which is good for business travellers. The gym is small and the pool is a lap pool that opens at 7am (would be better opening at 6). There is no restaurant at the hotel but there are a few nearby and even more at Changi City Point. There is no Minibar, but a Fairprice Xtra within 50 meters that is very convenient. Breakfast is held at a nearby restaurant that has a mix of east and west for breakfast. Once the road works are finished this will be a very convenient hotel, but they need directions/signs at the MRT station to point you in the right

title: Convenient Business Stay
desc: Located directly in Changi Business Park, Park Avenue is only a short drive away from the airport and has many restaurants and coffee shops around. Also the MRT station as well as the exhibition center are only a short walk away. The rooms were nice and clean with huge windows and good facilities. They do not serve breakfast and the pool is super small. All in all, the hotel is nice, good location, friendly staff.

title: Holiday
desc: Very clean,friendly staffs and nice room...i would love to come bck again next year and celebrate my birthday! :* i love the design of the room except the bathroom..the toilet is too small for my boyfriend.thats all..

title: Away from the Hustle & Bustle of City
desc: Appreciate the efforts displayed by the front line staff as they are empowered to let me check in early and upgrade my room with hassle. It is a great staycation as it is less crowded than the hotels in the city. The swimming pool is exceptionally small though. The eateries are just a stone's throw away and a NTUC Supermarket is just a few steps away where everything one needs is readily available. However, of the 2 nights we stayed, I could not get hold of The Straits Times, my staple reading material, even before noon. It seems that there is only one copy placed at the reception and if it is taken, there is no more left for guests.

title: Comfortable, compact, friendly, good location
desc: Very comfortable, compact rooms. Ideal location for work in Changi Business Park. Helpful people. Stayed in one-bedroom apartment well fitted out, microwave and hotplate, combination washer/dryer that actually works. Very good wifi connections. Close to supermarket and restaurants, easy access to MTR and shopping center. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Luxurious Stay
desc: Stayed at the suite with a kitchen and separate hall. Had TV in room and living area. The hotel is very near to Changi Businesses Park, you can reach office in five minutes walking. The staffs are very friendly

title: Nice hotel in changi city
desc: Had a staycation here on 8/2. Got a 1 bedroom executive suite. It is more of a service apartment with a small kitchen, utensils, washing machine, etc... Nice rooms but the area seems small. Location is ok, just opposite is a big supermarket(NTUC). EXPO MRT, shopping mall (changi city point), singapore expo (convention and exhibiton centre) is just walking distance from the hotel. They have shuttle service to the airport and if the timings are not good, EXPO MRT is just one stop away from Changi Airport MRT.

title: Business hotel in Changi Business Park
desc: The Park Avenue Changi is near the MRT station and a shopping mall with shops and restaurants, but it is also in Changi Business Park, far from the city centre and its amenities. The hotel is best suited to business travelers who conduct business in the Business Park, although there is a free shuttle service to nearby destinations. The hotel is a straightforward business hotel, with nothing fancy by way of facilities. There is a single-lane lap pool on the 10th floor and a well equipped gym. Breakfast is provided at a nearby restaurant which serves dim sum normally, so it is a selection of traditional Chinese dishes with a sprinkling of Western – a couple of cereals, fruit cordial, bacon, etc. You do get congee and some dim sum as well as cooked breakfast though – noodles or

title: Nice place to stay near Changi Airport, easily accesable
desc: Stayed here for Business in December 2015 and would definitely recommend this as a place to stay if you are looking on the East Coast of singapore, close to the airport. Rooms were comfortable but basic. Gym was good enough, same with the swimming pool. Very close to Expo MRT station which makes it easy to get anywhere in Singapore. Also next to a supermarket, big shopping centre and a number of good restaurants, including a couple western specialists. 24 hour check in/out which was handy. Construction going on around, but couldnt hear anything and I was overlooking it. Could not fault this hotel at all.

title: OK for Business
desc: It was just for one night after landing in Singapour Airport. Close to the aiport, need a taxi to go there. Nice room, confortable. The hotel is in a business area. Several restaurants outside for diner.

title: Good location but let down by lack of maintenance
desc: We stayed at the hotel because of its location, being close to the airport, MRT station and Changi City Point shops despite the inconvenience of the ongoing MRT line extension. We were disappointed by a number of glitches, which were mainly due to poor maintenance - the shower rose attachment was loose and the TV remote not working. Still, it is clean and comfortable, and the reception staff efficient and friendly.

title: Very convenient
desc: I had meetings both in Changi Business Park and at Tampines. For the meetings in CBP I could walk and for those in Tampines a taxi or Uber took me there in 10-16 minutes with very little traffic delays. The hotel is also right next to the Expo MRT station which meant I could get to and from the airport under my own steam and get into the city and back without the need for a taxi. My hotel room was quiet and comfortable and the staff were very friendly and spoke good English. Breakfast was included and provided at the next-door restaurant. I was only able to eat breakfast one day of my stay because all other days the restaurant was absolutely packed with tourists - who I imagine were on layovers from China. Not a big deal for me; I just took a coffee and ran. There are

title: Nice clean convenient hotel
desc: I stayed here for 12 nights for business. The hotel is in a very convenient place for the airport. Its about a 5 min walk from Expo metro station which is one stop from the airport, also near by you can find plenty of places to eat a big supermarket and a large shopping mall around a 10min walk away. I stayed in a two bedroom suite which was plenty big enough for x3 people. The rooms come equipped with most kitchen utensils which becomes very handy when you just want to eat in after a long day! It's a very clean friendly hotel with good wifi. I would recommend it to anyone.

title: Good hotel if you have an early plane.
desc: I essentially changed planes in Singapore with an interval of less than 12 hours in Singapore. The hotel is less than 15 minutes to the airport. It was clean with helpful staff. The room was small but with good facilities including a well lit desk area and a number of international power adapter sockets. There was some mechanical type noise from the next, I am sure whether that was a guest or the hotel. It was short lived even though it was late but this suggests that the rooms may not be well sound proofed. It is across the road from the metro so getting anywhere is Singapore would be easy. Anyway it was a comfortable night with minimal time lost travelling to and from the airport for considerably less that the "airport" hotel even taking into account the taxi fares.

title: Last Minute Staycation
desc: I checked in with my 2+ year old daughter on last Sunday (7 Feb 16). It was a last minute spontaneous decision to book the hotel. Since it was CNY, the hotel was one of the best rate found online. We got a room on the 8th floor. It was a nice room but I found a cockroach crawling on the bed when I was about to go to the bathroom. Erk! As my daughter was too excited to bathe in the bathtub, I had to fill up the tub. I saw a few strands of hair which was quite gross. My daughter was a making a fuss, so we went out for a walk. When we came back to the hotel, I gave feedback to the reception regarding the cockroach and the issue of the bathtub. Helmi (I hope I got the spelling correct), straight away suggested for me to change room which I really appreciate as I do not want to sleep

title: Clean and Close to the Airport
desc: Needed an over night accommodation to break up our flights. Nice, near new Hotel. Quiet area with some food stalls nearby, and a large supermarket. Only about $10 taxi ride to the Airport, but you can also catch the MRT...only Two Stops away from the Airport.

title: Convenient to Airport
desc: This hotel was a convenient one night stopover between flights at Singapore airport. There is not a shuttle for the hotel, but it is a reasonably priced taxi ride to the airport. I did not realize that there was actually a hotel with in the terminal, and I would suggest looking at this as an alternative, but I don’t know what the price difference would be. You will save having to take the two taxi rides if you are using this as a layover hotel as we did.

title: Great Hotel close to the Airport in a Business District
desc: This hotel is located just off the Expo stop of the MTR line and is walkable from the station (it is literally opposite the station) It is great if you are on an overnight stay over in Singapore like I was - I took the MRT well sign posed in the airport to the hotel and back again. The hotel itself is very clean and the rooms were more than adequate, with good size bathrooms, good air con, excellent free wifi and breakfast over the road at a neighbouring restaurant. I would highly recommend the hotel for an overnight stop as it way cheaper than the on airport hotels but very easy to get to.

title: A hotel that really came through for us
desc: The Park Avenue Changi is a first-class but limited-service hotel near Changi airport. It is located at the EXPO MRT station, one stop from Changi Airport and the across the train tracks from the Singapore exhibition center. It is next to a major shopping center (Changi Centrepoint) with lots of restaurants, etc. While staying at the Park Avenue our family experienced a serious medical emergency. The Park Avenue manager and staff were highly professional and very helpful. We wouldn't have made it through without them. If the test of an organization is its performance in a crisis, the Park Avenue performed. It is also a very nice hotel, perfectly clean, great service, etc. Highly recommended.

title: Not what we expected for the price
desc: First the taxis had problem finding this hotel, however it is copse to the MTR which makes getting around easy once you are checked in. The check in time was firm at 3:00 pm and we had left our cruise ship at 9:00 so we had 5 hours to kill before we could get access to the room. This hotel does not have an indoor lounge or bathrooms, so my elderly mother, who struggled with the heat and humidity, had no where to wait and had to come out with me for the day. The afternoon staff was incredibly helpful and friendly compared to the morning staff. It was a quick taxi ride to the airport from the hotel. The room did not have the 2 beds as requested on our reservation but the room was clean and well stocked. The local restaurants provided a variety of choices within the complex.

title: Excellent location, Modern, Clean and Close to the Airport
desc: I had an overnighter here at the Park Avenue Changi and would quite happily recommend it for longer stays. The room was modern and comfortable with a comfy double bed and ultra modern bathroom with combined shower/bath. Some tips of luxury in terms of toiletries and accessories were noticeable.and the room was extremely clean.Located only a 10 minute taxi ride from the Airport, the Hotel is in the heart of Changi Business Park with a short walk to Change City Point shopping centre which has some eateries in it as well as a small selection of outlet stores (the outlet stores were not much in comparison to other centres around Tanglin and the Orchard Ave district but it is not bad if want somewhere to browse or grab a bite to eat). There is a FastX supermarket directly opposite

title: Awesome service
desc: Booked a double superior room through amora.com for our first staycation. However upon checkin, the staff told me that all superior rooms are twin. We brought my 2yo son along, so twin room is really not suitable for us. Without saying much, the staff, Tasha immediately proceed to check for other room options and upgraded us to deluxe king room. Super grateful! The room was clean and comfortable. My son loves the bathtub alot! Location was good with supermarket, shopping centre and expo nearby. After we checked out, got a call from the hotel informing me that i've left my ipad in the room. I was so careless, i didnt even realized. Really thankful for this awesome group of staff and their superb service!

title: Highly recommended
desc: Nice Hotel friendly staff. Check in was easy and we were given nice rooms with a view. I pre paid these rooms on Expedia. The hotel looks new and is close to eating places, or take a taxi to Jumbo Seafood. We did have a hard time with getting a taxi to drive us here from the airport. It seems that a few taxi drivers don't want to drive 5 mins for a fare. However the hotel calls for the taxi to come get us and orders one to take us to the airport. See photo I will post. I like this hotel and area.

title: Wonderful staycation!
desc: Stayed on 1jan 2016 for a night staycation. Did a gathering with friends & family & surprisingly there was no complain regarding noise issue.. Hotel management was very understanding and acoomodating.. Our guest were amazed too. The rooms we stayed in was one bedroom suite,. Spacious suite! Clean. Housekeeping staff always come on time when in need. Thank you! Memorable stay, we feel welcome and enjoyed much! Will definitely come back!

title: Fantastic short stay
desc: We have a few days in Singapore and we stayed here, it was great. Very modern, clean and the staff are very welcoming. It's in a good location, not far from the airport. There a several shops near it as well as Starbucks, which came in handy for us.

title: A business trip and a pleasant surprise
desc: I stayed in Park Avenue Changi for a month. The very first thing I liked about this place is its location. It is placed in middle of a business center, banks and software companies which makes it a very good place for business stay. And the Airport is in vicinity which makes it even desirable. Next big thing I liked most is the service and the staffs. They were very courteous and helpful. They follow strict rules. Cleanliness is everywhere and it was a great pleasure to feel it. They don't allow smoking in the suites. If you try, they levy fine for it. I was lucky they gave me a warning. But still they expressed it on a very professional manner without any threatening. I liked it. And they where very helpful around the clock and without any sign of disapproval on their faces.

title: A Good option for a Singapore transit
desc: We arrived late into Singapore and had an early morning flight, so we didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel. What we found however was a very comfortable, clean and modern hotel, only a 10min cab ride from the airport. Both check-in and check-out were fast and friendly. Wifi was good in the room and there was also tea/coffee making facilities. It was a good transit option for us on such a short stay.

title: Staff needs to lighten up
desc: Staying at this Property for only one night to fly out early morning. The Hotel is easy and fast to reach by MRT, you have to get out at Expo station, from there it is a 5 min walk. You already can see the Hotel sign when you stand on the Platform. Keep in mind there is not much to do except a big Brands outlet Shopping centre is in walking distance and also lots of Restaurants. Coming into the Reception area you could notice straight away a beautiful fresh room spray. Tasha the Girl who checked us in needs to lighten up !!! A smile doesn't cost anything but keeps guests happy. Our room was very quiet from the outside with a huge floor to ceiling window. Everything was very clean and beds were comfortable with crisp bed linen. We had a bath shower which is not as easy to

title: Close to the airport
desc: This hotel is good if you need a one night layover in Singapore. I wouldn't recommend if you are to stay longer. There is not much thing around the hotel. Staff can be slightly more friendly and welcoming.

title: Great Staycation
desc: we had a wonderful stay during November,booked for deluxe ,was upgrade to 1 bedroom suite as hotel was full.great front desk team excellent service.i notice the negative remarks by Travellers who complain about small issues,we all adults treat them with respect as you wish to be treated.Kudos to front office team & Housekeeping.Thank you for all your help & kind assistance.Will be coming back in December.Wishing all merry Christmas happy new year!

title: Good hotel near airport
desc: Park Avenue Changi Hotel is the convenient hotel near airport. Singapore standard. In the morning hotel guests can have breakfast at "Yum Cha restaurant" which provides international and asian food. There is convenient store next to the hotel name "Fair Price". In conclusion, the hotel is good worth your visit.

title: Looked like a disaster unfolding. Turned out Pretty Good!
desc: I had booked on-line and paid in advance, in the ‘Requests' field I asked the hotel for advice on transport from the airport, but nobody replied to that in the 4 days between my booking and my arrival. I made very sure I selected the correct room-type, not a ‘Twin'. I even stipulated in the 'Request' field (as I always do) ‘No smoking, King bed please’, and took screen-shot that as I always do. I am continually cautious of being put in a single bed. I am not 5 years old anymore and coming from New Zealand I really suffer in the heat of Asia. Rolling over into the cool side of the bed-sheets is vital to me being able to sleep at all, no matter how cold I can get the room. I started to cringe as the taxi pulled up…. they really could win an award for the most

title: Good Hotel in Changi business Park.
desc: If you mean only Business, then this is a comparative cheap hotel with no frills. Rooms are neat and clean. Just outside Expo MRT. Lots of eateries and fairprice outlet. Also Changi Point Mall is 2 min walking. But no entertainment or crowd after 6 PM. Only the Mall side has some bars and some crowd.

title: Hotel near Airport and expo. Still under construction on that area.
desc: I have been stayed this hotel for 5 nights. The room is quite small compare with the room price. I paid around SGD250 per night. For breakfast, The hotel provided us the Indian restaurant. At first day I had breakfast there. I could tell everyone from China, HK , Korea , Taiwan or Thailand that all of us could not eat at all. So the second day and the third day, I didnt go to have breakfast. By the way, I heard someone said that there was another one which is Chinese restaurant. So i asked staff to whether i can chang to that one. Then they said can change. So i recommended all staff at the hotel to provide the chinese restaurant for Asian ppl as the first choice. But if your guess is Indian. U can provide Indian restaurant. Another thing is surrounder around hotel still under

title: Convenient location, clean and quiet
desc: We needed a hotel near Changi Airport for ease of getting an early morning flight out of Singapore. This hotel exceeded our expectations. It is just a 5 min. walk from the MRT Expo station, or a short cab ride from the airport. Staff were exceptionally helpful. Our room was clean and quiet. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but there are many options in the big shopping mall nearby. We would recommend this hotel for people needing accommodation near the airport. It was good value for the price.

title: Very convenient for overnight near airport
desc: A very decent clean hotel close to Changi, in the nearby industrial area. Although the room service and restaurant choice is limited in the hotel itself (and information on this point was not well explained to us; apparently there 'was' a restaurant but it had strange opening hours and you couldn't charge to your room), there are shops nearby and external restaurants in the business park. The room was clean and fresh and the concierge and porters were very helpful with local information and getting taxis.

title: 5 days Business Trip
desc: This place is pretty good, near airport, wifi is good, near to changi business area. but you have to walk out for breakfast, because this hotel dont have their own resto. pretty quite neighborhood. thats all

title: Excellent service at front desk
desc: Great location in Changi Business District. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. Close to airport and Expo station. Staff are friendly and eager to help. My company left messages and these were delivered via letter under door, as well as via the television.

title: Great Location
desc: We stayed overnight on a stopover from Australia to China. Unfortunately our flight was delayed so we literally only had time to sleep before returning to e airport but our room was fine, room service provided a tasty meal and staff were friendly and courteous. A five minute train trip from Changi airport terminal the hotel is located across the road from the Expo station thus conveniently located. Definitely would recommend to fellow travellers.

title: Stayed here while attending Expo Centre - an average hotel.
desc: This hotel is conveniently located for the Expo Centre in Changi just the other side of the MRT railway station and a 10m walk. There is no restaurant or bar making breakfast tedious as you to go to a small restaurant across the square where obtaining a decent selection of food was a challenge. They had everything you may want but the staff would not bring everything to the buffet at once forcing you to watch carefully for a delivery of fresh eggs or orange juice and then making a dash for it before everyone else got there first. The room was adequate with free wifi and tv etc but nothing worth watching. Overall it was quite expensive and definitely not four-star. Finding food in the evening was easy due to thirty plus restaurants being available in the complex. The quality

title: Compact room, too compact beds and forgettable breakfast
desc: The hotel is located next to the Expo station, suitable only for business and people working in nearby offices. Nothing much to do around except good walking track and small mall nearby. Rooms are small and compact. Twin beds are terrible if you are tall and was uncomfortable for me. Barely could manage couple of hours of sleep each night. Not good for more than a day or two. The bathtub is compact as well. No restaurant in the hotel and they serve breakfast in the nearby Yum Cha and Muthiah restaurant which look not so good and the options are terrible. The Changi city point is the only mall nearby with the Plaza 8 also having some restaurants. There is a Fair price xtra next door which is a supermarket. Overall avoid if you can unless you are on business next door.

title: A weekend staycation
desc: Booked for just a night staycation with hubby in the deluxe room. Upon arrival, checking in process was a breeze. The lobby area is not as big as those 5 stars hotel but the space is nice and cosy. Given a room right at the corner and at the 8th floor(rm 828) since I have requested for a quiet and higher floor room. Room is nicely furnished and upkeep. Maybe the place is still rather new, basically the things and amenities in room are good working order except for the audio or sound bar remote. I think the battery ran out and yet to be replaced. As the room didn't come with breakfast, there's quite a few options around the hotel for people like us to have our first meal of the day. For locals or people who likes HK dim sum, you can head to Yum Cha just opposite lobby area.

title: Poor sound insulation and poor build
desc: At its best this place is ok. At its worst it is annoying and noisy. Would I stay here again. Not a chance. Staff are lovely but not a good hotel. I only wish that estate agents/realtors were not moonlighting as hotel photographers.

title: Nice
desc: Check-in was smooth and Fast. Greeted by warm and friendly staffs. Very well-trained and equipped with knowledge to guide me around the area, although there isn't much to see at night. Pleasantly surprised when I was offered Early Check-in from a very early flight. Room feels very new and their amenities are adequate. Beds are very comfortable and I felt very well-rested. Kudos to housekeeping for maintaining the rooms to look ever-refreshing. Would be good if they have a business centre, but the reception staffs are helpful enough to help me print my documents I require. Very good stay and would definitely try again!

title: Highly recommend
desc: Like many others, we needed a room for one night in Singapore close to the airport, and everything was full. However, the Park Avenue had rooms. I have stayed in several near-airport hotels and most rank just above terrible, so we were not expecting much. We were surprised that everything from check-in late at night to check-out early in the morning went perfectly. The staff was kind and accommodating and the room was surprisingly great! The room was a bit small to spend a week or so there, but for a night or two it is perfect. The front desk called us a taxi the next morning which promptly came and were were off again. Thanks for a lovely stay. If we need a quick overnight place to sleep again we will be back.

title: Nice and convenient location, Great service and so on...
desc: We stayed in a 1-BHK serviced apartment for entire month of November 2015. I opted for this since I was working in One Changi City. - Good for walk-to-work if you work in Changi business area. - The aptt is compact i.e. all stuff necessary for a comfortable stay was provided: induction cooker, utensils, mini fridge, bedside table and chair, wardrone, iron, cable TV etc. - Always courteous, smiling and helping staff - never would you not hear a greeting when you pass by any staff member. - Small gym, single lane lap-pool, small but nice roof top area. Nice city views from the top: can possibly see as far as 15 km to tall buildings in south. - Decent complimentary breakfast in restaurant in next building. - Very well maintained property and aptt, all good quality stuff: Linen,

title: Top spot for Airport Stopover - Don't just pay for a few hours day bed at the airport.
desc: Had a stopover in Singapore for the day & really needed a few hours sleep. Airport hotels were all fully booked & the day bed option was very expensive. We called a few hotels with no luck, thankfully found a tip to head downstairs & book a hotel external to the airport & this hotel was recommended. The service at reception was lovely & we were quickly to our rooms for a much needed sleep. The room was set up like an apartment with separate bedroom - The room was very dark, quiet & beautifully air-conditioned, bed was very comfy. We paid for the room from about 10am-6pm which was cheaper than 4hrs in a day bed. This enabled us to have a sleep & then pop out to Singapore zoo & leave our bags in the room ready for us to come back for a shower & taxi back to the airport. Highly

title: Fine hotel for a business stay
desc: This hotel was very nice, and staff super helpful. It's practical and comfortable. The room was perfectly nice, wifi reliable as well. The location is great for the local mall as well as the business near by. The mall has a great selection of shops as well as bars and food outlets which is great as the hotel does not do food. It fairky close to the airport, my taxis were between $13 - $17 but there is a train service which stops just outside the mall. I'd stay there again next time I'm in the area.

title: Modern, clean and well equipped.
desc: We enjoyed a spacious 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment that suited our needs perfectly for an overnight stay before flying home to NZ. Modern furnishings, clean and well equipped. A nice lap pool and gym area with stunning views. Very close to the City Point Shopping Mall with Outlet shops for many of the leading sports brands Nike, Addidas, New Balance etc.

title: Weekend staycation
desc: Booked a room via Groupon for my family. It was a great stay. The front office staffs are very accommodating assisting us with an early check in. We are lucky and happy to have a room so quickly. Housekeeping department did a good job too as the room was well maintain and smell fresh! We look forward to another enjoyable stay!

title: Very comfortable hotel in the heart of the Expo area
desc: This is a very nice hotel. Staff are friendly and helpful. The room was well equipped with quality fittings. I can honestly say that the bed was the most comfortable I think I have ever slept in. The only downside in the room is getting the temperature right; when the a/c is off it's too hot and when the a/c is on it's too cold. The hotel is only a 2-3 minute walk from Expo MRT station (which is just one stop from the airport) and the attached shopping mall with its outlet stores. Whilst there is no restaurant in the hotel, there are plenty of options for eating right outside or at the nearby mall. The pool and gym are small but fine. The pool is a narrow lap pool so very nice if you have it to yourself, but could feel crowded even with a second person in it. Be aware that there

title: Simple and only simple
desc: Do not expect much on this hotel than sleeping...while within the new Changi business park, close to Airport I have been disappointed on my 2 days stay there. Empty fridge, no internal coffe shop/ restaurant, no internal breakfast serving. The room are clean (hopefully for such new hotel) while moisture are already much present in the bathroom, unacceptable. My colleague did not have the soap and shampoo refilled before 2 days... Very pricy hotel and low grade in features Also do not sit outside as a colony of mosquitos will make your stay even (not) memorable. Breakfast is served in a separate place in a Japanese restaurant but again very simple and far from normal standard

title: A true business hotel
desc: This hotel is very very straight forward and extremely 'high density'. I'd refer to it as a no frills hotel. I had a room with two single beds. There was construction next door but not too much of a hassle. Noise wasn't a problem either being in close proximity to the airport. There is a mall next door which is decent and an MRT station not too far away. I didn't go for the breakfast, but it is located in a restaurant adjacent to the hotel. I'd call this place simple and sweet.

title: Good transit hotel
desc: I stayed at the hotel for one night in transit to the UK. The hotel is in a good position for the airport and half the price of the airport hotels. The reception staff were very efficient and friendly. The room was very well equipped. The hotel has no restaurant and I went across the road for breakfast which was unusual.

title: Staycation via Groupon Promotion
desc: Check-in with my wife to celebrate our 20th year wedding anniversary. Mr Chuck who is stationed at the front desk has helped us with the check-in. Everything went well till we check-into the room 808. My wife is surprised that we are given a room with 2 separate single beds. I called up Mr Chuck to arrange a room with King-size bed and was told to wait for about 1 hour for the room to be ready. While waiting in room making coffee for my wife, I noted there is no bathrobes in the room. Thus, I called the front desk to arrange for 2 bathrobes to be ready in our new room. About 1 hour later, a Malay male staff came and hand-over the key for room 502. Check-into the room and yet the bathrobes are not there. This time I called the house-keeping and was told to wait again. I am

title: Good hotel
desc: We really liked this hotel. Great, friendly staff, lovely spacious well appointed room, great rooftop pool, and close to airport and Changi Village, and very close to several really good restaurants. Only lacks a restaurant (but can get meals delivered from nearby one).

title: Comfortable stay in Singapore
desc: I was here for a night only, is very close to the airport. Comfortable and cleaned room, my bed and pillows were really perfect to restore me after a long flight. Very gentle and kind all the personnel at the desk. This hotel is also close to a mall if you look for some shopping or special restaurant.

title: Great for travel or business
desc: Room was clean with Wifi, tv, mp3, bath, comfy bed, air conditioning. The hotel is close to airport and a short walk to train station, Singapore expo and a shopping mall. It was perfect for one night stop over and for business travel.

title: excellent service
desc: we are very impressed of the front desk clerk service . we were given the room early cos we are tired for 1 night. Very professional service and room are small but clean and comfortable. pool small but nice to rest for a day. total stay excellent. THANK YOU FORNT OFFICE FOR A VERY GOOD AND HELPFU AND FRIENDLY STAY. YOUR TEAM IS ONE OF A KIND. we will definitely come back and recommend this hotel

title: close to airport and nice, affordable hotel
desc: it was a clean and nice hotel, there is a supermarket and few restaurants near by. it took only less than 10 min from the airport but it is half price to airport hotels so very affordable if you want a sleepover sort of thing. Although if I was to stay more than one night it would be difficult as they did not have room service at night time and nothing at the bar fridge, because we have jet lagged needed to eat at night etc. If you prepared for that, not a problem.

title: Good hotel for quick stopover near Changi Airport
desc: This is a good hotel for a business stay, particularly if you are going to be at the Changi Business Park and looking for a place to stay near the airport. It also serves as a good stopover point for a short stay and much cheaper than the hotels at the airport. A short and affordable taxi ride away. The hotel is in a quiet area and there are various restaurants dotted around, a supermarket opposite the main entrance as well as a reasonably sized shopping centre very nearby. The room was clean and spacious with the various amenities one would expect. The bed was comfortable, the WIFI had decent bandwidth and the air conditioning not too loud to disrupt sleep. The only small let down was the shower. One would expect a proper shower than a hand shower over the bath. It was rather

title: Good for business travel
desc: Nice clean and modern establishment, well located for a Changi Airport hotel. We stayed one night when flying out, met our needs nicely, nice soft bed. Probably better suited to business travellers than tourists, no mini bar stock, Restaurant is off-site but the room service meal was great. Very helpful staff and easy enough to get a cab. Not much to see locally but it is out near the airport. Overall pretty good value if this is the style your looking for.

title: one of the Privilege services served by them....really! Most luxuriest room and bestest zoom location.
desc: We arrived early and we have given the room early and service was fast and excellent. Reception was friendly and helpful. We love the room and the gym. Check out was efficient and fast. Thanks you front desk team for a memorable stay. Excellent service from your team!!!!... We will come back again.

title: A decent stay
desc: The rooms were comfortable. Right inside Changi business park. Very near to major destinations like Airport, Marina Bay Sands and major tourist spot. For breakfast you have to go to another hotel near to this. The food options were not very good atleast not for me. Definitely not a menu for a business hotel.

title: Good choice near airport
desc: If you are in Singapore only for activities near Changi Business Park and airport, then this is the best solution for you. Clean, cost, and of nice service. And the price is considered reasonable. Swimming pool is only of one person usage. MRT station is only 5 minutes walk.

title: Practical and efficient- for 2 nights tops. More- go downtown.
desc: Stayed 10 hours at this hotel as my flight got in at 1am and my main hotel (Marina Bay Sands) wasn't available till the afternoon. I had read the mixed reviews here so wasn't expecting very much but I must say I was very surprised and somewhat impressed! The room (suite) was very clean, very practical, and very efficient. Loaded with washer/ dryer and kitchenette facilities, it was a much better option than the pay for use lounges at the airport. Negatives were- took the taxi driver ages to find because of the construction. The bathroom wasn't that great. You could literally hear the water draining and it felt "old". The location isn't great either. And for the price it could have been better but again its good enough for a night, maybe 2 if you will out all day.

title: Great transit hotel.
desc: Rooms are small, though well appointed and very stylishly decorated. Very close to Changi Airport so very accessible if you're transmitting between flights. No breakfast at the hotel, but you can purchase vouchers for either of two restaurants close by.

title: Stayed for a conference!
desc: Requested for a standard twin room and was pleasantly surprised for the room upgrade to an apartment, with full kitchen appliances, glassware, silver and China ware. Together with a washer and dryer build in. Naturally my friends and I had the urge to make breakfast, with the convenience of a local supermarket within 5mins walking distance from the hotel. This includes- the Singapore Expo, local train station that connects you to the city, the airport and an outlet mall-Changi City Point. Areas to jog around the vicinity, in the morning was pretty enjoyable as well. Complimentary parking is available for single entry. Locals do note! The only down side was the construction, that is in between the hotel and the outlet mall that has been there for a year-ish. Couldn't hear

title: Excellent stay
desc: We arrived early and we have given the room early and service was fast and excellent. Reception was friendly and helpful. We love the room and the gym. Check out was effievient and fast. Thanks you front desk team for a memorable stay. Excellent service from your team!!!!... We will come back again.

title: Good Business Hotel
desc: Generally while in Singapore I prefer to stay nearer to CBD. This time my work is in Changi area , my Office has chose this place. This is quite near to the Airport and early in the morning , taxi charged about SGD 11.00.One can also come by MRT and get down at MRT Expo station which is about 8 minutes walk. They were good enough to give me an early check in. Rooms are pretty decent and the bed is comfortable. The amenities in the room , bath are reasonably ok. This is more like a business hotel. There are no restaurants in the hotel. My room tariff included breakfast. But the hotel made arrangement with one Muthiah Restaurant nearby. They hardly have any breakfast spread and least interested in customer service. Of course there are a number of other restaurants nearby.'

title: Close to the airport and has all conveniences
desc: We booked an executive room (one bedroom suite) and it was well appointed. Had washing machine, dryer combo (took 3.5 hours for a wash) and it is next door to a supermarket, and food court. The room was very clean and modern. It is a non smoking hotel and you need to go down to the ground floor and a fair distance outside if you need to smoke. There are no balconies.

title: Good Hotel for Expo and Business in Changi
desc: Situated in the Changi Business District - Small room good for business traveller. Well located near to MRT and the EXPO. Very helpful receptionist, knowledgable about MRT's stops and exchange, and food outlets in the city. Next door to the Fair Price supermarket. Food outlets in the next building available on weekdays only . Food Court available Changi City Point next to the MRT station. Taxi drivers from city may not be familiar with hotel address so need to check. Best is to get on the nearest MRT and stop at EXPO station. Walking time about 7 minutes.

title: Another great option for long airport layovers
desc: We had a 15 hour layover at Changi airport (a Sunday from 6am to 9pm) and the Transit Hotel was fully booked so I turned to the next closest reasonable hotel I could find. such a great experience here I'll come back the next time we have a long layover. We had day use of one of the standard rooms for about 120 Singapore dollars. This got us use of the room for up to 8 hours. I've never used a room at the Changi Transit hotel so hard to compare but I know this is a more reasonable option. Easy access using the MRT ($3.20 per person round trip) and short walk (200m). Clearing customs (terminal 3) was quick as well but probably depends on time of day. Plus being right on the MRT line allows easy connection to downtown. Hotel is in an office park so was very quiet on a

title: Booked twin room 1 month ahead but unavailable
desc: I had specifically booked a superior twin room a month ago, however upon check in, the front desk staff said twin rooms were sold out, we had no choice but to accept whatever the hotel provided us. Front desk staff told us with an attitude like we had been "upgraded" and we should feel thankful despite preferred room type was not available. No apologies, no compensation, only offer an extra blanket and that's all. I asked for twin bed surrendering the so-called "upgrade" but of course impossible. In my opinion it is a fraudulent act to accept booking for a certain room type but failed to deliver, it is well known that twin-room usually costs more due to extra labour and extra linen laundry. Should I have known twin room was not available I would have booked elsewhere instead.

title: Room a little pokey, and breakfast in some unpleasant Indian restaurant.
desc: Was a little underwhelmed by the unfriendly welcome of receptionists, and then further more by the room, which felt very confined. Location is one stop, but it would be good for the hotel to offer some shuttle service. Breakfast was an irritation as it is contracted to some Indian restaurant, which is difficult to find, and the hotel give unclear instructions to property. The breakfast food is cheap, unpleasant and heavily spiced. Not refreshed at all when I call late in the morning.

title: Special thanks for Nurul Huda
desc: I had a one night stay at the hotel. i checked in on the 19th of july. Upon check in, the staff ( Nurul Huda), upgraded me to one of their suites. it was a very nice room, the room was very comfortable. i just want to thank Nurul huda for her service rendered. She is polite and the whole process of checking in was fast n hassle free. Thank you Nurul, you are an assets to your company. Your polite disposition and warmness touches me. i would like to feedback something negative about the hotel. This morning, i went to the ATM to draw some money. when i was walking back, i slip and fell flat at their front lobby. They were cleaning their premises but they forgot to put the signale to tell or inform guests beware of the wet floor. i had a pretty bad fall and my right side of my

title: Very Good Hotel
desc: We stayed for 1 night and we arrived early which we know that check in is 2pm. We were very delighted that we were given a room on the spot even its 9am in the morning. What a excellent first impression. Room was small but clean and modern. Pool okay and gum is very new.....front desk was very helpful and treat us as family. Good training for staff. We had a wonderful stay and we will definitely come back.

title: Unpleasant Staff
desc: We recently stayed in Park Avenue Changi for an overnight transit in Singapore. We arrived in the hotel at around 10pm and were received by an unfriendly receptionist who did not put a smile at all. I was asking her what would be the solution to the breakfast on the next morning since we have to leave at 6am and they only start serving breakfast at 7pm. She simply turned us down by saying we can't get the breakfast because breakfast start at 7pm and there is nothing she can do now. It was ok not getting the breakfast but I would appreciate more if she could serve us with a better attitude. She simply looked like an unhappy employee and it is so wrong to be behaving like that when she works in a hospitality industry. The hotel room itself was clean and comfortable. We have

title: Quiet, peaceful transit stay
desc: Great Hotel new and close to Changi airport ($16 taxi fare). Good breakfast and service excellent. We got a room upgrade as they had given us a twin share not a double as per booking. Easy 5 min walk to MRT station and mall. We used this as a transit overnight stop and due to its business park location it was very quiet and peaceful overnight

title: Excellence!
desc: A beautiful, new hotel. Rooms are cleanly ultra-contemporary, floor to ceiling glass, comfortable bed, smart TV, free Internet. Service is spectacularly efficient and dignified. Wonderful experience. No restaurant in the hotel, it's really a business hotel, but there are many fine restaurants just next door, and many more in the Changi City Point mall less than a 10-minute walk. 5 minute walk to the Expo MRT station.

title: Best Hotel in Singapore
desc: Check in was pleasant and professional manner. Staff help me and my family til the hotel lift and explain how to operate the key. Room was small but clean. Upon check out it was a fast and efficient. I'm a local and I was treated fairly. We enjoyed our stay and thank you so much for a wonderful stay and be back again.

title: Great hotel for transit
desc: We were in transit from Melbourne and had to stopover Singapore for 16 hours so we decided to find a nearby hotel to sleep in and leave our bags while we look around Singapore for a few hours. The front desk staff are friendly and the room was nice and clean. The bath tub with clear glass adjacent to the bed was pretty weird though.. Overall, we had a good nights rest and this was very near Changi Airport as well. It took us maybe 5-10 minutes to get there and did not cost us a lot of money with the taxi.

title: Worst ever service in a Singapore hotel
desc: Stayed from 16-17 May. Disastrous staycation! No pleasantries during check in. No 'Have a pleasant stay' from ur Indian looking female staff. I asked HSKP(PRC lady) for additional shampoo & body wash & she couldn't understand. Had to make 4 trips to my rm before items were correctly delivered! During check out, the Malay lady behaved like as if I owe her a living & was abrupt & curt. Again, no 'Thank you for staying with us'. Customer service is non existent! Perhaps they do not extend the same courtesy towards fellow Singaporeans.Looking thru at some comments posted earlier, I wonder whether it is the same Hotel! Wrote to the Hotel 3 days ago and have yet to receive any response! Capri By Fraser is a better alternative. And room size is bigger there wth much courteous staffs!

title: Good Stay for Staycation
desc: Had a pleasent checked in by the front desk staff, as we were hungry, one of the staff given us choice of selection of the places around the hotel which we do not need to travel so far as we were quite tired too 1) Upon entering the room, although the room is small, but it was just fine. 2) good for travellers doing transit 3) Quiet and nice 4) have a nearby shopping centre about 5-7mins walk away which i do not need to travel all the way down to downtown just to do shopping. 5) housekeeping did a fast and efficient job when i need assistance.

title: Staycation
desc: Excellent location to stay.Staff were very friendly and helpful.We were greeted bt friendly reception Staffs upon checking in which makes us feel so welcomed.The rooms are very nice and cozy.Overall it was pleasant stay. Highly recommended.

title: Great stay, enjoyable and comfortable
desc: My entire weekend was made just by staying here. Not only were we greeted by friendly receptionists, the rooms were also really comfortable and clean to be in. Also, check in and check out services were very efficient and the bell man was very helpful. Thank you for having us here. My friends and I really enjoyed ourselves. Will definitely be returning again!

title: Best Hotel
desc: We stayed for 2 nights and it was a great experience. We arrived early but room was given early by front office which I beleived they know we are tired. Check in was fast and professional. Staff training was excellent with somebody greet you when you arrive and offer luggage assistance. Room was small but clean. Pool small and gym was new. Thank you and we will be back definitely. Excellent service from front liners team. THuMBS UP!

title: Business location
desc: If you have work in the Changi Business park area, you have still 2 choices. The Capri and the Park Avenue. I stayed this time in the Park, reasonable in price and comfort is ok. Slight disadvantage is that no restaurants are in the Hotel ,but nearby. The traveller has to adapt to it. Staff is very friendly, rooms are clean although small. For a short stay recommendable.

title: Nice business hotel
desc: The hotel accommodations were clean and professional. Close to several restaurants including a food court at the mall and an easy walk to the Expo MRT station. Breakfast was decent and provided by a restaurant next door to the hotel. Great location if your office is located in the Changi Business Park.

title: Big rooms, very little charm, and no in-house services
desc: My first time using this hotel. Normally I woudn't choose to stay in a hotel in the middle of a business/industrial area. However, I was in Singapore to do only one day's work with a client and the office location was only a 3-station MRT trip away. And it was very close to the airport - only one station away on the MRT. The positives: 1. a very large room. Turned out to be a self-contained apartment really. Ideal for long-stay guests and/or families. My room comprised a living area, a dining area, a small kitchenette (which was equipped with a decent size fridge, a microwave, a washing machine, and a sink), a twin bedroom, a king-sized bedroom (ensuite), and a separate bathroom. 2. Being that the hotel is pretty new, everything worked and was in a good state of

title: Lovely hotel!
desc: We stayed at the hotel for a few nights in early May.. we were greeted with such friendly reception staffs upon checking in which makes us feel so welcomed.. They also have complimentary wifi which is actually really great.. The room are also nice and cozy.. Overall it was really a pleasant stay..

title: Very Nice Hotel Near Airport
desc: This hotel was a great find on a short stay. The rooms were decorated very nicely. The bed was very comfortable and the staff was extremely friendly. The shower opening into the room was a little unique but a great hotel.

title: Amazing room. Exceptional Service
desc: Greeted by an experienced bellman, who offered to carry our bags from the taxi till our hotel room. Hotel is nearby the airport and took us only 10mins to reach. Check-in was fast and efficient, and we were offered complimentary early check-in which we really appreciate. Receptionist was very pleasant and her smile was warmth. Rooms looks fresh and the beds are very comfortable. Good for short stays and transit due to distance to airport. Will stay again.

title: Good standard but little character
desc: This is a good quality hotel, about 10 - 15 mins drive from the airport (cost about Singapore $12 in a taxi), offering slightly better value for money than hotels right by the airport. Check-in was rather slow with little rapport, but check-out was efficient. The TV wasn't working when we arrived but they fixed it quickly. The room was nicely designed and finished with a huge bed and good shower. Shortly after we arrived a woman delivering letters to the rooms, knocked and immediately entered the room before we had a chance to say "come in" or not! The letter said that due to exterior maintenance don't be alarmed if you see a man dangling outside your window! Overall a good bet.

title: Great Hospitality
desc: We were treated really well at the hotel.. Checking in didn't take long.. Reception staff was very polite and also kind enough to remind us if we had left anything behind during our departure and the taxi was already waiting by the time we came down.. How convenient it was as we did not need to wait so long for the taxi.. Great teamwork! We will surely be staying there again...

title: Park avenue experience Stay
desc: The reputation is well deserved. A truly special hotel to stay in. I am frequent business traveller in Singapore. I was very impressed with the ultra friendly staff who made my stay extremely special. It was my 70th birthday. Front office wish me happy birthday when I check in which I almost forget that day is my birthday. Check in is fast , I get complimentary upgrade. The suite is amazing, everything was clean. Overall I have great stay here

title: Fantastic hotel
desc: Hotel is in a good location, near alot of amenities.. The room is abit small but it is very clean and tidy.. The reception staffs are very helpful and always greet us with a smile... They give prompt wake up calls upon request.. Great job!

title: Modern but low service
desc: I stayed there for 9 nights, four of those and the room had not been cleaned by 4pm after work. On the Sunday when I wanted an afternoon rest I switched on the do not disturb sign, twice the maids knocked and woke me, reception called to ask if I needed room service then the TV message system bleeped to ask the same. There is no bar or restaurant, you need to go opposite; it is a block with beds, no soul. It is located ideally for the Expo, MRT but little else. Many staff very helpful, others could not be bothered. Maybe start up concerns, I leave you to take the risk.

title: Close to the expo but less good room and even less breakfast
desc: I stayed two nights for business and the hotel is very close to the airport and Singapore Expo so that is great. However, the room (327) was not so good. Bed OK but cupboards rather shabby (difficult to open and close). The breakfast is in a restaurant nearby that is very noisy and very unfriendly staff. The staff was moderately friendly and helpful and I would have higher expectations for a 4 star hotel in Singapore

title: Excellent service
desc: The room is very nice and clean.. Reception staffs are very friendly and efficient.. Went the extra mile to provide an excellent service! Overall, its a good stay... Will definitely come back again...

title: Good hotel near the airport
desc: We really enjoyed our stay here. The staff were very helpful, and the room was large and comfortable. We would definitely stay again if I had business in the area or wanted to be close to the airport, which is a short taxi ride away.

title: Suitable for a short stay but don't expect a shuttle
desc: We just stayed at this hotel for one night as we needed an easy option for our ten hours in Singapore before flying to Vietnam. We booked 2 rooms as we have 3 small kids but they were unable to offer us interconnecting so my husband and I had to split up for the night. Room clean, basic, smallest bathtub I have ever seen and rooms tiny. Close to lost of dining options. Major drawback is they don't offer an airport shuttle so you need to pay $13 each way for a taxi, which to be counts out the convenience of a hotel at the airport. Probably best staying right at the airport and paying a little more or even in town which is only an extra ten mins in a cab! It was average we won't stay again but if you pick up a cheap prepaid rate you are probably ahead

title: A decent hotel
desc: My work is always around Changi Expo Mart so I always stay here, the hotel has a decent room size with a small bathroom. Breakfast is elaborate which happens in next door restaurants. The place is walking distance from MRT station to the approach is very good.

title: Amazing Service
desc: Hotel was quite far from the city but service from reception was exceptional, very fast and efficient service. Upon check in, check was fast with smiling face. Room was small but clean and comfortable. Upon check out it was very fast and efficient too.....thank you guys for making my stay a wonderful like home. EXCELLENT RATING for you!

title: Fantastic Hotel, close to airport, amazing service
desc: Wonderful hotel with amazing rooms. Overall a very positive brand experience from the moment I arrived to the moment I departed. Thank you to the great team! I will be back next time I am in Singapore.

title: Small room yet no service given
desc: Front desk was so not professional during check in. Did not smile at all. Room was paid online and yet she ask deposit from me as if i owe money from her. Bell man was nice to show me the hotel facilities and offered assistance with luggage.

title: Convenient, and clean modern hotel
desc: A fairly modern hotel, conveniently located near the airport, convention center, and the business district. The rooms are small, but comfortable. There are no amenities in the hotel, but there are several food outlets and a mall within a short walk from the hotel. The hotel is also close to the train station. If given the choice, avoid the off site breakfast option, as it's pricey and not that good. All in all, this is a reasonable place to stay.

title: Great hotel if you need an easy access to the Business Park, Airport, Cruises and the Singapore Expo!
desc: I was staying there for three nights for a congress at the EXPO. Great hotel, wonderful service. The breakfast is not something to write about. The hotel is located 3 minutes walkign from the EXPO MRT, EXOP and the Changi Point- a great outlet hotel. A supermarket just two minutes away. Great!!! note that it is quite far from city center - about 9 stations with two transfers- 35 minutes to Orchad/City hall

title: Perfect place for a short stay near the airport
desc: I just stayed for 1 night, arrived in the late afternoon and departed early in the morning the next stay. It's easy to reach from the airport by metro, just 1 station away. From the station EXPO a brief walk around 5 min to reach the hotel. The room was quite big, clean and comfortable. In the area are lots of restaurants and a supermarket.

title: Excellent accommodation and service
desc: We left our cruise ship at 0900 and our flight was not due to leave Changi until 2320, so we booked a day room at Park Avenue Hotel. I could not fault this hotel. Check-in was smooth, friendly and efficient. Our room (333) was huge, with lots of space to open and re-pack two large cases and two smaller carry-ons. The bed was unbelievably comfortable. The bathroom had all the toiletries we would need, there was an iron and ironing board and tea/coffee making facilities. WiFi signal was strong and the helpful receptionist printed out our boarding passes. Later, they called a taxi for us and (importantly) advised us that the cost to Changi airport should not exceed SD$15. I would certainly recommend Park Avenue, and would love to stay again.

title: Last hotel I would choose in Singapore
desc: I would like to KISS (keep it short and simple) on my experience I had stayed in this hotel for 6 days in 3rd week of January 2015 Pros: 1. Very near to Expo MRT station 2. Fair Price Extra is the grocery shopping store which is right next to the Hotel 3. In Changi Business Park which means a brisk morning walk will help you reach your office 4. New building Cons: 1. The hotel neither has one restaurant or a coffee shop 2. Rooms are stuffy, too small and does not have space or table to keep your checked-in bag (at least in the room I stayed) 3. TV Channels have very limited option and the relay was scrambled 4. Entire hotel is no-smoking zone. So smokers may not like this I would not come back to this hotel and would not refer to anyone

title: Great hotel for business near EXPO
desc: Overall a very good hotel with a good service and large and clean rooms. overall i would say this place deserve a visit if you come for business to EXPO or need to stay around the airport for a day or two. the rooms are well done, bathroom is nice, although i don't understand the design of having a glass wall at the bathtub and next to the bedroom. I dont really need to see TV while I am showering or using the toilet but hey thats my personal opinion. I have stayed here twice within the same month and have booked once the normal double room and also stayed at their apartment, nicely appointed with great facilities. HK team does a great job, the place is very clean! Staff is always smiling and some of them are very friendly. I enjoyed my time in this hotel and would definitely

title: Suitable if you have to attend an event at Singapore Expo
desc: This hotel is good value and is the closest one to Singapore Expo. I recommend staying in this hotel only if you have to attend a conference/ event at the expo. For holidaymakers, I recommend staying somewhere else. I found the room and toilet small. I do not recommend you take twin sharing. The single bed is extremely small. The size reminded me of my school dormitory. If you are staying alone and attending a conference at the expo, this is the perfect hotel.

title: Convenient Hotel for a brief stopover in Singapore
desc: I stayed at this hotel during my brief stopover to Singapore arriving from Vietnam in the evening and leaving to Europe the following evening. The hotel is located about 200m walk from the 'Expo' metro station. This is the first station on the way from the Changi airport to the city. How to reach the hotel from the airport: Take the MTR towards the city. Get off the train at the first stop "Expo". In Feb 2015, the ticket price was 1,20 SGD. Exist the metro station into the direction from where the train came (i.e. into the direction of the airport). Walk along the above ground rail track, with the track to your left. You will find the street with the name "Changi Business Park Avenue 1" to the right after about 200m. Enter this street for 50m. The hotel is the building at the

title: Breakfast Poor
desc: The hotel does not have its own restaurant with breakfast provided in a Yum Cha cafe nearby. Good idea if it works but the cafe could not cope with the number of guests (less than 20) who needed breakfast a 0830. Did not trey again and had breakfast elsewhere. Location good for Expo

title: Nice hotel.
desc: Stayed in this hotel close to Changi Airport for two weeks during a business trip. It's a nice hotel with friendly staff, clean rooms and located close to the airport and some shops nearby so ideal for a quick sleepover or business trip. I would not recommend it for a holiday stay as it's 30 minutes from the city center and it doesn't have any restaurant, also the pool area is VERY small you can hardly call it a pool ;-) But anyway I would definitely recommend this hotel if staying near Changi is your goal.

title: Perfect near-airport stayover with restaurants, groceries, shopping, transit
desc: The Park Avenue Changi Hotel is one stop on the MRT (metro train) from Singapore Changi airport. Unlike in many cities, the one stop to the airport is priced as just a regular stop, so for me in January 2015 it was S$ 1.50 (plus 10 cents for the reusable ticket). Since the airport MRT station is right in the center of the airport the Park Avenue Changi Hotel is in effect an airport hotel that you can reach on an airport shuttle for a nominal fare. Just take the MRT to Expo station; from the standpoint of a person arriving at Expo station from Changi, the hotel will be behind you on the left. The one downside is that in 2015-2016 Expo station is under major reconstruction due to the expansion of the MRT, so you do have to walk about 100 yards along a temporary path fenced

title: Decent hotel for near the airport
desc: We stayed here due to a stopover and early flight. Great hotel, rooms are clean and tidy and the staff are all very friendly. There is a small narrow pool, however it could really only fit 5 people (laps and playing) There are a couple of restaurants near by if you like Singaporean food. There is a 'western style' restaurant nearby, but we didn't venture there. The bars in changi point shopping mall are not far, although the there are a lot of roadworks it's tough to find the easiest route. We needed up walking towards the MRT station and through the shopping centre. If you know your way around the MRT and Singapore it's a great location out of the city. If you prefer the hustle and bustle of the city this isn't the place for you. If you use it as somewhere to crash

title: One of the most accomodating staffs Ive ever encounter in all my SG trips
desc: Its my 4th time to be in SG but first time not to stay in the city. Location:This place is too close to the airport. Like 15mins or less. There is fairprice for cheap grocery goods, 24h convenient store, restos nearby, Mtr EXPO Station, and Changi Outlet Mall. Nothing much to see in the mall. But you can find cheap stuffs from Nike, Samsonite,American Tourister, and G2000. There is also decent restos in the mall as well as techie stuffs. Not too bargain but a bit cheaper than in Manila. You can still get GST refund if you spend 100sgd single purchase. If you intend to shop better take train to Tampines station. There's a lot of great shops like Sephora. The area is quite boring unlike the bustling city. There is no tourist attractions so for first timers this is not a good

title: Not luxury but very adequate, clean and comfortable
desc: I was in Singapore on business and spent 12 nights here on a bed and breakfast tariff. The room was twin singles - which became a double when they saw I was on my owm. The staff are great! It is very close to the Expo MRT station (one station from Changi aiport) so transport is no problem Breakfast is in a restaurant (Chinese during the week and Indian at weekends). The hotel has other restaurants and shopping close by. I was puzzled when I arrived because I saw no common place to sit - till I realised it was outside, which was lovely, I just wish I'd had time to sit there! I was impressed when someone came to fix my TV, on day 3 as I hadn't reported it faulty, however he spoiled the illusion by saying I had reported it - concluded it was the previous occupant. The wi-fi

title: Average Airport Hotel
desc: Like the title, an average airport hotel. Situated roughly a km or two from the airport, it was convenient for a 12 hr layover. The room was clean and the staff were friendly enough. If I was on vacation, I wouldn't choose this place again but for a quick layover, its perfect.

title: Comfortable and Convenient
desc: Stayed for two nights on a business trip to Singapore. Very handy if your work location is Changi Business park, and not the city. 10 Min Cab ride from Changi airport. heaps of eateries, cafe's etc in vicinity, as well as a convenient supermarket if you need something..There is an MRT station nearby too. The hotel is basic, service is efficient and courteous, and the rooms are clean and tidy.Felt it was slightly overpriced, but considering the costs in singapore for hotels i would say that's the norm...

title: Excellent transit hotel option
desc: This modern hotel has rooms that are easily up to a 5 star standard, but at a very affordable price. Actually this hotel could possibly be the best value hotel in all of Singapore. I stayed here because I didn't want to stay at an airport transit hotel (they are usually booked out anyway and/or very expensive) and Crowne Plaza was sold out. The hotel is only a $13 taxi fare or a 5 minute walk from Expo MRT. You can be checking in within 10-15 mins of clearing customs. Apart from being close to the airport, the Expo area is now full of new shops and restaurants (including large shopping centre) and so you could easily stay at this hotel for longer trips to Singapore. The hotel has good facilities and helpful staff. This hotel just about deserves 5 stars from me, too bad

title: Very Pleasant and Cozy Hotel
desc: Upon arrival to hotel I was very warmely welcomed to hotel by curteous staff. They checked us into our rooms very quickly. since there was three of us 2 adults and a child the gave us an apartment like suite with all emnaties. We had to large flat tvs, mini kitchen with stove and washing machine, iron and the list goes on. Very good for long stay guests and I strongly recommend this hotel. Price was very worth for what you're paying for. Definately going back.

title: Very clean and convenient Hotel
desc: Stayed here for business for 4 nights. I arrived very late so I was not able to take the MRT - so unfortunately had to deal with yet another taxi driver that didn't know where he was going. He punched in the postcode on the address on his GPS and it led us pretty close to the location. Unfortunately as GPS' do, it wanted to cut through a warehouse to get to the hotel - luckily I stopped the taxi driver in time - shows you how reliant some people are on a GPS instead of looking at where you are going. The hotel provided breakfast as part of the package which was the Yum Cha restaurant next door. It was adequate - a few dim sums, other standard hot foods, etc. There are lots of other restaurants nearby, but no local coffee shop if that is what you are looking for. There is a

title: Quiet and near to the airport
desc: Great staycation. Hotel is walking distance from the Expo MRT however due to some construction nearby, probably need to walk one big round to the hotel. There's a supermarket opposite the hotel if you need anything and a shopping mall walking distance away. The room is clean and spacious and the bathroom has a transparent glass which you could actually see through to the living room. Not to worry much as there's roller blind for those who are not staying alone. Good selection of channels too and request for higher floors if possible.

title: Nice Experience.
desc: Stayed in the one-bedroom suite. The suite was excellent. Was really clean and in good size. Kitchenette was great and comes with induction cooker, microwave, a good medium size refrigerator and basic utensils plus pots and pans. There was also a washing machine provided. Suite comes with 2 tvs, one in the living room another in the bedroom. Complimentary internet access was fast, just what a business guests needed. Living area was good for two guests. Super comfy couch with throw cushions. A tampered glass top dining table was provided too. Bedroom was great. Bed was super comfy. Working desk in bedroom was large enough to work comfortably. Closet was big enough and there was ironing board and iron provided too, which not all hotels readily provide(need to request which

title: Very disappointed
