desc: Arrived Singapore late and had a layover for one night. Stayed at Park Avenue and all I can say is what a disaster. Taxi couldn't find the place ... finally arrived at approx. 11pm and just wanted to relax in a room. Took what seemed forever to finally check in after so much mucking around with paper work at the front desk. Went upstairs to my room to find the bedding wasn't what I had booked. Had to wait again for somebody to finally come up to assign a new room. Went to make a cup of tea - no sugar no tea bags - had to call reception and wait again. Nothing around this area at all if your looking to eat and hotel doesn't have a restaurant. Reception apologised and gave me a cup of noodles. The room was comfortable but I felt like I was in a box. Not a overall good

title: Great Expo hotell
desc: Perfect location, very close to Expo center. Walking distance even after a full day of standing up and chasing customer. Clean, fresh nice and great hotel. Good beds to sleep on. Close to hotel is a shopping mall, were you find most what can be required. Friendly staff.

title: The Hotel is great - but far away from "town"
desc: The rooms are beautiful, clean with the best bed I've tried in a long time! There is a big gym, with everything you need and a small but nice swimming pool on the roof! The area is a business area with a big shoppingmall, but there are no bars or any people.. At 10 pm only Mc Donald is open.. We stayed because we had a course at expo that is out there, but moving in to town to get better location!

title: Great Location
desc: Stayed overnight on a stopover from Europe. The hotel is about 100m from the Expo station of the East West rail line (one stop from Changi airport) so it is very convenient for travellers. The Hotel is modern and the staff were excellent. I would certainly stay there again.

title: Great hotel!
desc: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for one night en route back home from Bali. We checked in at around 2:00am and we were very pleased with our choice of hotel. It's 10-15 mins away from Singapore Changi Airport and the room was as comfortable as you would expect a 4/5 star hotel to be. The Park Avenue Changi is 45 mins or so away from the hustle and bustle of the city in the business district, close to the MRT if you want to travel into the city but also located amidst a large supermarket, plenty of restaurants and quite a big shopping mall. The staff were great. We wished we had stayed there for longer and will certainly consider staying here again.

title: Great location for Expo and MRT to anywhere
desc: We stayed here for a conference. Booking on Expedia got us a very good rate. There is no restaurant and only a plunge pool, but there are many restaurants and a grocery within 300 meters and also a fairly large shopping centre about 10 minutes walk away. It is less than a 10 minute walk to the MRT, which affords inexpensive and clean travel almost anywhere in Singapore. The staff are helpful. They do need to improve the software on the key card used for lift access; you need to do the process 2-3 times each time, but it ultimately does work. We will stay at this hotel in the future. It's very near the airport, which is also convenient.

title: amazing hotel
desc: this hotel is amazing. they had a very helpful reception staff and efficient service. we arrive early and room was ready for us. luggage assistance is there and fast check in. we had upgraded cos they are full in room i booked. the room was compact and clean. pool was small but its fine important is the room. we had a perfect stay over this hotel and staff was definitely amazing.

title: Excellent hotel, wonderful staff
desc: The hotel is located one stop from Changi Airport, a stone's throw from Expo MRT station. We were greeted by very charming and friendly staff who checked us in quickly and offered us a complimentary upgrade. Our room was impressive by any standard, but particularly so considering the price. The City Point mall is next door for outlet shopping and two food courts (I recommend the basement over level 2). Due to its proximity to the airport this hotel is an obvious choice for transit, but as the MRT is so quick and easy we would happily make this our base for a city break. We were very pleased with our stay here and will certainly return.

title: Right in the middle of the Changi Business Park
desc: The location is very good - in the middle of the Changi Business park, short walk to the MRT if one wants to go into the city and lots of restaurants around due to the prevalence of the "food court" culture in Singapore. Nice decent sized room with a Lounge, a Kichenette and a separate bed room. Very quiet and good furnishing with all amenities. Only hitch was a "dusty smell" in the corridors while walking to the elevators

title: Friendly staff, Absolute terrific,wonderful staycation
desc: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights . The rooms is clean and spacious. Ive got a very good and quiet room . The front desk staff were helpful and always smile. Location is good, just 5 minutes to Expo Mrt, opposite the hotel have big supermarket. They have gym and swimming pool, but swimming pool too small. But overall i have great stay, i will be recommend to all my friends, and definitely will come back stay again

title: Quiet place for a weekend staycation
desc: Located amidst of the Changi Business Park, this place is undeniably quiet for a weekend staycation. Thankfully, Changi City Point is a stone throw away, so you still have access to food. Room and service were average, nothing memorable for us to go back for a second time. For more details, please go to http://wanderlust-tales.blogspot.sg/2014/08/park-avenue-changi.html or http://wanderlust-tales.blogspot.sg/.

title: Wonderful stay
desc: We stayed for 1 night and the hotel was pretty amazing. Front desk staff was excellent service. Check in was very fast and staff was very helpful. We had a lot of luggage and lady front desk help us and go out of there way to help us til the lift. Room was small but clean. No housekeeping can speak english. We will come back and thanks for a wonderful service front office GUYS!

title: A little bit pricey as compared to the quality and facilities provided...
desc: I was on a business trip to Singapore and found this hotel on the web. After reading through the reviews, I thought of staying in this hotel. This hotel is overall a good one, but if you compare the price to pay at this hotel to the facilities provided, I think it is a little bit expensive. I feel the only reason it is expensive because it is located in the Changi Business Park area. This hotel does not have restaurant of its own. So if you come back late from office, there is nothing that you can eat. There is a decent size mall (Changi Point) close to this hotel. Also couple other restaurants in the close vicinity. The only plus point I see in this hotel is that it is close to the Expo MRT station. Other than the above, here is something that I observed: 1. The wireless

title: Disappointing
desc: The rooms are small even by Singapore standards and the facilities are quite poor as well. Breakfast is in a small restaurant outside the hotel with very less spread or options and the fitness centre opens late in the morning and the swimming pool can at best be called a strip of water (not even two people can swim at a time). If you are going to stay for a very short period and you work in Changi, you can consider this as last option. Else, avoid

title: One Of My Favorite Hotel Stays- Memorable
desc: I love this hotel. My wife and I stayed here one night during a layover in Singapore. After finding out that we were on our honeymoon, the gentleman at the reception desk made sure to take very good care of us. We felt special and valued as customers. I appreciate the amazing service we received here. The building is also very clean and well kept. I recommend this hotel strongly.

title: Great suites!
desc: Had this booked months ahead for my daughter's 21st little party. Got a two bedroom suites with kitchenette, washer & dryer too. Party of 10, just us and her besties. They had 21 little dares for her and even going around the hotel and hotel staff nice enough to play a little part too. I wanted to say my biggest thanks to make it happen. The staff and the hotel management too. I would surely reckon this place as there are amenities around like supermarket, restaurants, bakeries too! Hope to be back here again!

title: Excellen stay
desc: Thank you for he excellent say. The staff was very efficient and helpful. They were very attentive too because when I ask for direction they were their to help always. I asked to print something also they were very helpful and no trouble at all. The room was small but very clean and tidy. I will definitely come back here because of the staff excellent service in the reception. I come to singapore for business prospect and usually I had a lot of groups with me to recommend which hotel is nice in singapore. THUMBS UP GUYS!! JOB WELL DONE!!!

title: Opposite MRT
desc: We stayed here as we had early morning flight and it is only one stop from airport. However with MRT being directly across road, we bought a Singapore tourist pass for the day and found it very easy to get around Singapore. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. The only problem we had is we could notmturn bathroom light or wardrobe light off and it kept room a bit to light. There is a shopping centre next door and this had lots of eateries. The staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Nice business hotel
desc: I have stayed 2 nights in this hotel for a tech conference at the Singapore Expo, which is literally 5 minutes walking distance away. There is nothing exceptional in this hotel, but it is good value for money. The staff is efficient, the rooms are very decent and quite bright and the price was not too high for Singapore. I would definitely stay there again if I have to come for another expo.

title: Airport Hotels
desc: Aiport hotels are so often expensive and give poor service because chances are you'll stay only 1 night and never be back. I use a lot of hotels. This one was clean, the staff were attentive and they have free internet that works. Although I wouldn't stay here unless I was here for business or on a flight stopover the hotel met all my needs. I'll use it again.

title: Good room
desc: We spent a night here recently. We used to stay at another nearby hotel, but their prices kept rising, so decided to try Park Avenue. The room was clean and bright and spacious. There are no restaurant facilities, and we found local food at nearby restaurants. There is building work going on, which makes access to Changi Point shopping centre more difficult, Hopefully this will sort itself out in time as those additional facilities would make life easier. The staff were very helpful, and sorted out a delayed checkout for us. We were happy and would return.

title: Couldn't be a better choice for access to the Expo
desc: I stayed here with my company for five days as we attended the Expo. It's an easy walk (It will be even easier when the construction is done). It's also very convenient to the rail service, shopping (A mall next door), LOTS of restaurants, a grocery store, and a whole lot more. The rooms are set up as suites (At least the ones we all has were) complete with a kitchenette and washer/dryer. The internet was fast, and the room was clean and comfortable. The staff as attentive, and always had a smile for me. Definitely a great experience!

title: Average, lacking key facilities to be rated 4 star
desc: Check in was excellent, my corporate travel firm had got the dates wrong and the hotel staff sorted it all out for me quickly and with no fuss. My room was comfortable, well appointed and well maintained. The rooms are quiet save for an annoying transformer-like hum that I couldn't isolate. The hotel lacks its own on-premises bar (you can go to Slackers next door) and its own on-site restaurant. For breakfast you are given a voucher for the Indian restaurant next door. The hotel is at Changi City Point mall which is open until 10pm and has a large selection of places to eat. All in all, average and not deserving of 4* status.

title: A+ Location
desc: Was here for a conference in March 2014. New and clean room and close proximity to Expo, eating places and supermarket. Bathtub design needs improvement for better draining from shower. Front desk reception was efficient but lack friendliness. A smile will be nice.

title: The good , the bad and the not so good..
desc: Price, very good, but only because downtown hotels are pretty expensive. Once you factor in cab rides there's not too much difference. That said , you can get rooms with hob , microwave and washer/dryer. Very handy. Great if you are working nearby , which I was , but moved downtown on the weekends as the business park has zero rec facilities.

title: Business hotel close to Changi airport
desc: We spent a night at Park Avenue during a 12hr stop-over in Singapore between connecting flights. My wife was travelling with the baby from a different country and we met at the hotel, which went as smooth as possible without much trouble to either of us. Hotel is about 10 mins drive from the airport & costs roughly SGD10 by taxi. The room was clean & comfortable.

title: Great property for airport stopover
desc: Park Avenue makes for a comfortable stopover for rest. Very comfortable and quiet. It is surrounded by conference centres, restaurants and a shopping mall within 10 minutes walk. There is no restaurant at the hotel because I guess it used mainly for conferences but then I don't really like hotel food and would prefer to eat out anyway. For me, the best thing was the gym where you could hop on a treadmill and watch the planes land at Changi Airport. Also the pool, although narrow, was a real pleasure to swim in. Staff were helpful too.

title: 26 days, tight sleep everyday
desc: was here in January 2014 for my business trip and I stayed 26 days, very long indeed. My first impression is this hotel is clean, good bathroom with nice tub and very comfy bed. The hotel near Expo MRT station, supermarket (Fair price), and a mall with many halal food in the food court which is great. the hotel has a fridge, clothes dryer even clothes iron. also several standard pack like toiletries and coffee / tea sachet. what I love most is the hotel is very strategic the cons is the hotel quite expensive. but it worth!! tight sleep everyday :)

title: Great Short Stay Hotel
desc: Very nice hotel in business centre about 10 minute drive from airport. Great to have all the amenities, including a washer/ dryer which was fantastic!! Area is business focused and has restaurants and shops (as well as a large supermarket/ food court) around. Staff were helpful and professional. Rooms were immaculate - as was the pool on the roof, although very small. The room had a separate bedroom and lounge area which is also great as one of us slept and the other watched TV. Room also had microwave and fridge -- also great!! I did not think it was that value for money - it seemed to be priced at business visits. Much cheaper options, but we wanted something easy and modern, which it certainly was! We stayed only one night as a stay-over in Singapore and it was perfect for

title: Good Hotel near Airport
desc: The hotel is convenient from the Airport and best for overnight stay. Beds are comfortable and the room is complete with amenities. Unfortunately, during our stay our nice view is obstructed by construction going on very close to the hotel. Place is also near food shops and shopping. I like the glass windows from ceiling to floor.

title: Location
desc: 1 night trip to expo, very near with the hotel just do 4 minute by walk, MRT station conect you to the airport And near the area got supermarket , restaurant so dont have to go any where Small receptionis area, Nice room, there bathtube but no shower place so water go out any whare because to small for shower Must find the solution

title: Great for overnight transit stay.
desc: Just needed a hotel close to airport that had good value, this is it. 10 minutes from airport and better value than some of the other airport hotels. Better than basic room and has all I needed. A mall next door allowed a quick top up of supplies.

title: More suitable for business travellers
desc: We stayed in this hotel because of the close proximity to the airport and it offers competitive pricing comparing to Capri or Crowne Plaza. The room was great, modern facilities, everything we needed for 1 night stay. Full-height windows but not sound-proofed. The swimming pool was disappointingly small. Only 1 person can swim in it at a time. If you are lucky, you can watch planes takeoff and land from the rooftop pool. Another improvement would be the staff, they need a little bit more smile, they look tired and worn, morning and night.

title: Nice hotel
desc: A pleasant hotel to stay. The service was extremely good. But be aware that washing machine is not available in any room type other that suite. And the laundry services provided is bit costly. The location of the hotel is good. It is nearer to airport and lot of hotels are available nearby.

title: Great value for a long stay
desc: We stayed for seven days at the Park Avenue hotel and it is definitely value for money. We especially loved the washer+dryer that was in our room as opposed to a shared laundry area, so thumbs-up for this! There is also a large NTUC supermarket right next to the hotel (closes at 10.30pm) should you need to buy necessities. I would not recommend taking the breakfast as there are loads more choices available right outside the hotel or even just a 10-min walk away at Changi City Point mall. It's a bit unfortunate that the construction was going on around the hotel so you would have to walk round them to reach the mall and Expo MRT station. Gym facilities was adequate however the pool was just a single 'lane' and at the time of our visit, it was closed for maintenance. Other than

title: Overall a great hotel!
desc: The hotel is near the airport, mall, restaurants and business buildings. Its also near a grocery ^_^ Pretty much convenient for those in business trip and would want to find good deals as there are numerous outlet shops.

title: amazing stay
desc: Hotel is quite new and rooms was lovely too. Reception staff was excellent and very attentive. They handle professionally our internet problem.The staff was always willing to help. The pool so small and outdoor. The room toilet glass had white stain and very blurd. Thank you for the staff at the reception for a wonderful stay. We will definitely come back.

title: Location
desc: A stop from changi airport. Easy access to city centre. Clean room,quite spacious. Equipped with iron & iron board and smart tv with tonnes of channels. Near to shopping mall,Changi City Point. Can get almost everything in the mall. Also, the food court has various stalls of halal food. Water pressure is good. Bathtub is a plus.

title: Only suitable really for a one night stopover
desc: We stayed at this hotel in March 2013 - not long after it opened. The room was fine, although the wife was not too enamoured with the big window by the side of the bed looking into the bathroom! As a business hotel, or somewhere where you intend to stay for several days (which we were) it didn't really work. No restaurant was a real pain - having to go out looking for somewhere to have breakfast and other meals each day. The staff weren't very helpful (but they were new, so by what other people say they have got better). Being there on business, having access to the internet was very important, and they failed miserably on that. When I tried accessing it I got a message that the site was barred as they were a Spamming centre! They had to get in touch with the company who looked

title: Not cheap, but it's worth it
desc: A business hotel, for business stays. One train stop away from airport and next door to expo. Plenty of good restaurants and cafes in the tower next door. Good rooms. Good beds. There is a small bathing deck and a narrow, one lane pool on the roof adjacent to a small gym. Comfortable.

title: excellent staff
desc: we arrived early and the staff was very accomodating. they gave us the room early without charge as per their manager approval. The manager looks like a filipino guy and very professional. he approved early check in and the staff treat us very nice. check in was fast and check qout too. the rooms was clean and spacious. i definitely recommend this hotel to my friends. thank you so much guys for your excellent service.2 thumbs up. thank you again.

title: Nice Stay and Excellent Staff
desc: I had stayed here for 2 nights. We are a frequent travellers that love to experience different hotels. We were amazed with the staff service and professionalism. We were given early check in without charge which seldom hotel do. This is the extra miles that separate this hotel to others. The room is small but clean and tidy. The pool quite small but okay we are not more on swimming type. Gym room is new and clean. This hotel is very good. Especially the RECEPTION staff that do extra miles just to serve guest like us. Thank you and you made our stay memorable. We will be back and recumbent this hotel to friends.

title: Nice Hotel
desc: Part Avenue is very good hotel and staff is also co-operative and excellent. This is also near to the MRT, Restaurant and shopping mall are on walking distance. Swimming pool, is very clean and and beautiful.

title: Strategic hotel
desc: I just stayed there during the last weekend since we had our event at Expo. It was conveniently located just straight the Expo MRT (5mins walking distance), 5mins from the Changi airport using the train too and of course it was pretty easy for me to walk to the event to and fro. The hotel size is standard, not too big but still have adequate space to move around and scattered our luggage around too. Though the bathroom is quite small but i enjoyed soaking myself in the hot tube. The staffs were helpful and internet connection was awesome :-) There are lots of eatery around the hotel so finding meals shouldnt be difficult.

title: Best 1 night stay
desc: Excellent hotel, very clean and modern with fast elevators and great facilities. Only a short 5minute walk to a large shopping complex. This was my first experience overseas, and it was very reassuring. The hotel was quiet with amazing hotel staff. and it was only a $7 taxi fair from the airport ((day) $25 for an early morning pre booked taxi). i recommend it for anyone stopping over in singapore. not so much for people wanting to see and do a lot as the surroundings is construction sites and office buildings.

title: Nice hotel. excellent staff. clean. good free shuttle service to mall, beach, and shopping.
desc: Nice hotel. excellent staff. clean. good shuttle service to mall, beach, and shopping. Away from noise of other parts of . Restaurant is OK. Pool very large and clean. We will stay again. We will recommend to anyone.

title: Very best location
desc: Hotel Park Avenue Singapore is a decent business hotel which provides good facilities and nothing exorbitant. However I found that to be really perfect for my business travel. You have all the required items in the room and the rooms are pretty good size with beds being comfortable for a good night sleep. They don`t have a restaurant but the location of the hotel is so good you have too many restaurants and eating joints next door. It is close and in the heart of the changi business park and that's a great advantage. The Metro station "Singapore Expo" is just 2 minutes walk and this hotel is strategically located in many different ways. The breakfast is provided in the adjacent "Manchurian club" restaurant and you have some default (limited) choices to eat. Mostly noodles,

title: good location for Changi Airport
desc: We had to stay near Changi to catch a flight early next morning, the Crown Plaza was full and the hotel desk at the airport suggested this hotel. The only draw back is that it is very new and it is difficult to find at night. if you arrive after 10 make sure you take some food with you. there is nothing open around the hotel late at night. It is possible to get to and from the airport by MRT, it is only one stop but you have to navigate round building sites to get to the hotel and if you have lots of luggage it is better to take a cab. The room itself was more than adequate for a short stay and I would use the hotel again if I can not book the crown Plaza.

title: Stay there if you need to catch an early morning flight
desc: We were stuck overnight because we had missed our onward connection to Phuket because of BA flight from London being delayed 3 hours. We had to buy a new onward ticket for the next morning: an 8 45am flight. The very helpful Singapore hotel association lady managed to find us this hotel for 150 Singapore $ which was 10 minutes away by taxi. It was a modern hotel in a sterile business park but it was clean, friendly and the bedroom had a huge TV and IPod Dock. The beds were terrific - very comfy. The early morning call was on time and so was the booked taxi. Of course I would only stay for business or as an overnight stop. For the latter it was a great choice

title: Great business hotel near Singapore Changi Airport
desc: I had to make a 1 day trip to Singapore for an urgent business need and was adviced to pick up Park Avenue Hotel at Changi. The hotel is a very short distance from the airport and that made it very convenient to get to from the airport.. else morning traffic can be quite painful if one takes a hotel in the city centre. Also my meetings were not in the city centre so it made it very convenient for me to stay here and head towards Jurong. The rooms were clean, well planned taking care of all needs of a business traveler. Hotel reception folks were particularly nice and courteous taking care of many things including day use stay, taxi booking etc. There are atleast 2 restaurant options just outside the hotel and that made it a comfortable stay

title: Excellent service for a very late booking
desc: I booked a room at the Park Avenue Changi on line just before midnight when my flight was cancelled. I was at the hotel within minutes of making the booking but the booking had not yet been received; however, the reception staff responded quickly and soon had me registered and on my way to the room. The room was very clean and extremely comfortable and met my needs; I slept peacefully for 12 hours, just what I needed between long-haul flights. Hopefully, one day I will make use of the hotels other facilities and nearby restaurants. Thank you PACH.

title: Park Avenue Changi
desc: I had to travel to Singapore for a Business meeting, asked to be booked into the Capri by Fraser where I stayed last time; unfortunately they were fully booked, so our office booked me into this Hotel which is very close by. The Hotel is very new and the staffs were receptive upon check in. Internet although fairly decent, automatically logs you out every short period of time, so constant re submitting of username and password was needed, which was a little frustrating. As the Hotel is very new, the rooms are what you would expect, as in everything new, clean, modern and pretty decent. Aircon worked very well, the bed was very comfortable. I must say I like to eat in the Hotels, as I am tired after meetings all day and rally do not want to venture out to get something to eat all

title: Room for improvement
desc: Amenities : bathroom amenities were great especially the shower gel, shampoo and so on. However I was disappointed that hotel does not provide bathrobes, which is quite rare for a business hotel. Staff: staff were quick to respond to requests when I called to request for technical issues and etc. Staff at the reception area could be more welcoming , they seemed to be unaware of guests coming in and they were seen lowering their heads doing some paperwork. When they were attending to guests, they were not smiling at all. Besides, there wasn't any bell boys to attend to the luggages. Wifi: speed was good but it practically logs you out every time. Hoping to see more "warmth" and smiley faces on my next visit.

title: Close to airport.
desc: We used the accommodation booking service at the airport to get a room here for only $150. It was gorgeous with kitchenette and a washer/dryer. Close to Expo station and we had breakfast from the Pricerite supermarket next door. The hotel minded our luggage for us as our flight did not leave till 8pm. The shopping centre nearby is also worth a look.

title: A decent hotel in Changi Business Park
desc: There are two hotels in Changi Business Park. This hotel is about same price with Capri by Fraser hotel but room space is much smaller when comparing. Many Indian restaurants are next to this hotel so I guess it is a place for Indian nations to stay. I do not like the fact his hotel actually do not have a restaurant and bar. All breakfast to be served in the restaurant next door.

title: Nice and clean hotel. Good for business
desc: I stayed from oct 1 until oct 4. This hotel is brand new. Great staff support, the room is not too big, but comfort and modern. Location is on changi business park. Wifi always on, hot water and very near to train station and mall. They provide ironing stuff and brush for your shoes, which i find it very usefull for business trip :). Definitely recomended if you doing business near changi.

title: Good hotel at a great location
desc: I stayed at this hotel in March 2013. The rooms are very nice and spacious. The hotel lies in a business area and It is close to a shopping mall. They do not have a kitchen or a restaurant so, do not provide any room service or breakfast. However, there are plenty of restaurants around this hotel with a variety of food options; Indian, Chinese, Italian, continental etc. There's a train station nearby which connects to all the places in the city. The airport is nearby too. You can either take a cab or go by the train. The hotel has a gym on top floor which is well equipped. In addition, it has an infinity swimming pool on roof top which is really amazing

title: Small, clean and convenience
desc: Ha ve business trip at Singapore and didn't want to stay in crowed down town so choose to stay in this Changi Business park where close to airport. The hotel was new and cant imagine the room condition and toilet condition were maintained great. But the shower head would cause water spillage out on floor. So better keep the slipper outside of the toilet. Be careful of slipping floor after shower. There was a numbers of local restaurants nearby but a lot of it was closed after 6.30pm. Could walk around 10mins to Changi City point for dinner. There was bars and clubbing area in Changi City point. The hotel was 10 mins away from the MRT so if was convenience if you would like to take MRT move around. My room window was facing construction site. I remembers some reviewer already

title: Excellent Stay in a Excellent Hotel with Excellent Staff
desc: First of all i would like to thank you all the staff you help us everyday and giving us the beauyiful smile everyday. The staff at the reception was exceptional. They were trained very professional and attentive. The rooms very clean and i love the shower. I will definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends. Good job guys and keep up the professionalism. Thank you making our stay wonderful!!

title: Great Transit Hotel
desc: Nice, modern hotel just 10 minutes from Changi airport at a price point well below Changi hotels. $S14 taxi ride there, $S20 back for a booked taxi. Modern spacious rooms. Good gym and (narrow) lap pool. Just 2 minute walk to a supermarket. In Sept. 2013 its still "new" so the taxi driver had a little trouble finding it.

title: A good business hotel in the Changi district, but as an airport hotel, it needs improvement
desc: Park Avenue Changi Hotel is a good business hotel located five minutes away from the MRT EXPO station. This hotel does not have any shuttle service to and from the airport, which is quite disappointing. Yes it is one MRT station away from the airport, but if you have many bags, I will recommend you taking a cab to the hotel, or if you are transiting, you should store the heavy bags at the airport "left luggage" facility, which are available throughout the airport. The MRT system in Singapore is very efficient and clean, and the ride to the EXPO station from Changi Airport is short. Due to the all the construction in the Changi Business District, there is no covered walkway to the hotel and you need to walk through all the temporary walkways. Hopefully when all the

title: I loved this hotel for many things
desc: This November filed to singapore and late at night booked park avenue through changi airport hotel booking counter.when checked in each of our room was well furnished all necessities were well placed. Free wi fI,all up o date system was ready to welcome. If the BF was also included it would have been better.no room service available ,no need for calling housekeeping just book your requirement through their set top box on a tv and it will be done.16 s$++ for each BReak fast was available at the first floor but we did not try as tired a lot.nearby mrt station expo just a few meters away from the hotel.change the line to reach in city wherever you want. The hotel rooms are decently decorated.a perfect match to their availability in a business park.taxis are available at all times

title: Quiet area (during the night)
desc: If you're a night owl and looking for place to hang out till the wee hours of the morning, then this is not for you. I like this place due to the close proximity to the airport (2 mrt stops away) and also it's located in a very quiet area during the night. This area is actually a business park, so I guess it's good for business travelers. I actually booked the standard room, but was upgraded to the one bedroom suite for the 2 times I stayed there. I was even allowed to check in early (1st time around 11 am plus and the 2nd time around 10am). But of course these are subject to their availability. The room itself is very well equipped even for a family. There is a fully automatic washing machine and a well equipped kitchen appliances (electrical stove, microwave, kettle and

title: Great hotel in Changi District
desc: The room is not too small for new hotel in Singapore, and in good quality. Big window, coz i always like room with window. The bathroom is also not small with good amenities. I only stayed for few hours as I need to catch the early morning flight. Its near the MRT station, so you can easily move here and there. There's also a mall nearby that you can get food or other stuffs. Its not the best place for leisure, but it can be option for business trip. Well I dont mind to pick this hotel again if I need to catch a morning flight.

title: Transit through Chengi
desc: Pretty average business hotel, pretty expensive. To be honest if there's 2 of you, by the time you have got cabs/train to this hotel your better off staying at the Crown Plaza if you are transiting. I suppose it would be ok if you were on business. Internet kept logging off which was really annoying. Also no room service which was unusual.

title: Good for business stay and adapted well for family stay
desc: I have stayed in park avenue for some months for business purposes. It is a no frills business hotel and pretty decent in that respect - clean and a good hotel to stay in if you are working on the east side of singapore. No complaints. There was a recent time though when my wife and 5 month baby came along, and the hotel staff were extremely helpful to make them both comfortable. Kudos to them, and a special thanks to Myron the duty manager that day for setting up the baby cot and being xtra helpful!

title: Good Stay
desc: The hotel is very close to Changi business park and very close to the Expo MRT station which is just 1 station away from the Changi Airport, the rooms were very good, a touch expensive with descent gym and a small ( thin ) swimming pool, only two people can swim at the same time. with free wifi its a good hotel to stay if your company is providing accommodation.

title: Excellent business hotel close to Changi Airport
desc: Park Avenue is a new hotel located in the Changi Business park which houses number of businesses. It is bang opposite to the Expo MRT, which is one stop from Changi Airport station. So if if you are transiting, it is a much cheaper option than Crowne Plaza at the airport. Rooms are small but have wall to wall, ceiling to ceiling windows which makes it feel roomy. Beds are very comfortable, and toilets are modern. One small issue is that there is no restaurant at the hotel, but plenty restaurants around it. There is also a grocery store in the same plaza as the hotel. Hotel to downtown takes not more than 20 minutes by taxi via ECB. The MRT takes about 45 mins, have to transfer between lines. The front desk team was very pleasant, courteous and helpful. They serve you with a

title: Park Avenue Changi Hotel
desc: First time to stay in hotel located within walking distance from the office, staffs were polite but sometimes forgetful (requested for a morning wake up call but never got one), morning breakfast starts 7am which is a bit late for an early riser like me. Room is very clean spic and span, airconditioning even though turned off is still very cold. There is no room slippers and night gown but other amenities like shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap and toothbrush, toothpaste, towels are okey. All in all service was allright, price for double bed is S$188 a night.

title: Excellent Staff Service
desc: Im writing this reviews just to show how satisfied and glad am I during my stay in Park Avenue Changi . Actuallly i stayed here before but that time i was not satisfied during my first stay. When I come back for my next visit, i was shock and overwelm on the reception staff professionalism and efficient service. Staff was so attentive unlike before and staff so helpful and ready to serve. It's not the price you pay but the service that they rendered which is satisfied me most. Being a frequent traveller, I usually come to Singapore as often and tried different hotels also but this Park Avenue Changi is one of a kind. I will definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends that usually visit Singapore too. Thank you so much guys for a wonderful service.

title: Clean hotel and good business location
desc: I usually go to Singapore for business trips which are usually at Changi Business Park. This hotel's location is perfect as it is walking distance from my office and it saves me the hassle and cost of taking a cab to and from work everyday. I am not quite sure if this hotel has a restaurant of its own but having Changi City Point and Expo (LRT station) at its doorstep makes up for it. The rooms are clean and cozy too. For improvement, I'd have to say the IPTV facility needs a faster connection. I can only watch the TV mode because Youtube was not able to load anything. Also, the staff can improve on making guests feel more welcomed.

title: Excellent business hotel
desc: This hotel is is very close to the airport and to the emerging business "IT" area of Singapore. It comes out as one of the best options if you have business in and around the airport or the changi business zone. Being a new hotel the rooms are clean and the stay is rather pleasurable. What the hotel perhaps lacks is a good restaurant, i did not find its alliance restaurant to be quite up to the mark. However there several eating options within 100 meters of the hotel. The existence of a large retail mall right next door takes care of the snack needs if you have one. The staff is courteous and in my fifteen days of stay I did not notice their presence yet the room was as fresh as every when you step in after a long day of work. The roof top swimming pool, through small,

title: Reasonable Rooms But...............
desc: Pretty good rooms - bright, modern and with comfortable bed. However, there are no public areas and even breakfast is at a café round the corner which is far from ideal. Strictly a business only hotel. I cut my stay short to move to a more central hotel over the weekend as it was not the place to spend any time.

title: will come back!!
desc: excellent hotel.. will definitely be coming back... tqvm very near to MRT.. easy access to all places to visit. u wont be dissappointed.. near to changi international airport. food stalls are near esp halal food.. what else do you want.. ;-)

title: A great transit hotel
desc: We arrived in SG around 2am and our hotel check in time (V hotel) wasn't until 2pm. My sister and I were traveling with our father who insisted that we book a hotel ASAP since he needed his sleep. Fortunately, I approached the hotel reservation desk at changi's arrival area who told me about this hotel. The fact that it was just 10 mins away from the airport and it only cost us $150 to stay until noon was the selling point. One of the first thing that we realized was that none of the taxi drivers knew where it was located since it's still fairly new... And the only taxi driver who decided to take us also got lost while driving us to the hotel. The room was great. Everything was new, clean and modern. The bathroom had everything you need.

title: OK If It Is Nothing But Business Only
desc: Our office in at Changi, and I'm on a visit here. I end up working two time zones. One in Singapore and one in Europe. So having a hotel at an easy walking distance, hop between the office and hotel, this place is just perfect. This hotel is newly built at the Changi Airport. Reception - staff can be more smiling, and should be friendly. When I came in/goes out, no greetings at all. They are doing some busy paper work. They don't even look up. I was not offered a bell boy to carry my suite case to my room. Corridors - have bright tiger stripes carpet. It is a bit narrow but travelling alone is OK, or two persons walk side by side is a little tight. Rooms - compared to SGD 300, 400, 500 hotels, the rooms are much smaller. However, the room rates as well. They are
